name: 3 Bedrooms, 2 blocks from Polanco - ALL RENOVATED!
description:
Beautifully decorated 3 bedroom apartment, it was fully renovated in April 2017. Wooden floors, marble bathrooms, sealed double glass windows (to prevent street noise) and air conditioning. 2 parking lot spaces premises. It is best suited for a maximum of 6 adults being confortable.

The space
- 24/7 doorman for security, the building also has camera. In the corner there is a Police Camera and also, the building right in front is from is a Bank Office with branch at street level, the corner of Mariano Escobedo and Mayran is busy all day long.

- I finished a full renovation of my apartment in April 2017: hardwood floors, marbel bathrooms, double glass sealed windows and air conditioning for your comfort.

-3 Bedrooms, the main room has its own bathroom and a queen bed, the other 2 rooms have a double bed and they share bathroom.

- Main room with a 50' smart TV and a desk suitable to work with a computer.

The kitchen is eq
neighborhood_overview:
This area is called Nuevo Polanco, it has being gentrified recently with lots of new building, restaurant and shopping places.

In 2015 a bank inagurated a 35 story building across the street, where there is a shopping place with a Supermarket, banks, Starbucks, dry cleaning and things for daily life, and in April 2017, Mercado San Genaro, a new open-kitchen place with over 20 options to eat was opened.

Around 5-10 mins by car or twice in rush hour, you have:
Going South - Polanco, Mazarik Ave. Liverpool Deparment Store, Reforma Ave.
Going West - Antara Shopping and Plaza Carso, with nice and expensive boutiques and restaurants, Jumex Contemporary Art Museum and Soumaya Museum.

Around 15-30 minutes by car (remember, no street taxis in Mexico City, only ubers) you can go to Zona Rosa and colonias Cuauhtemoc, Juarez, Roma, Condesa, Lomas.

Remember, no street taxis in Mexico City, only ubers!
host_about:
We are from CDMX and moved back and forth to NYC, doing a master a music. 
I love Mexico City, and I know every single thing to do and see, specially historical places and museums. More than happy to host you.

name: Great space in historical San Rafael
description:
This great apartment is located in one of the oldest neighbourhoods in town, the area of San Cosme used to be one of the four entrances to the ancient city Tenochtitlan. Very near the Revolution Monument and just 10 minutes to downtown. Many points of interests, traditional market nearby and lots of stores. Accesible transport, 2 minutes away from the bus and subway that will take you anywhere, there are also plenty of taxis in the area. Great location if you want to really know the city.

The space
Very nice furnished apartment, 7th floor, nice view, 80 mts. Great for academics, artists in residence or families in holidays. Security 24/7.
Great location 6 blocks from intersection of Insurgentes and Reforma Avenues located downtown.

name: Condesa Apartment in 1920s Landmarked Art Nouveau Mansion
description:
This newly redecorated (after these photos were taken) one bedroom loft style apartment is an addition to a 1920s landmarked Art Nouveau mansion. It has large shared outdoor areas and is in a safe tree lined park filled area with lots of restaurant and shopping options.

The mansion is a pleasant 15 minute walk from the museums in the Bosque de Chapultepec (Museo de Arte Moderno, Museo Tamayo, Castillo de Chapultepec, the world famous Museo de Antropologia e Historia, etc.) A pleseant 3 minute walk from Parque Mexico and Parque Espana. 2 blocks from Palacio de Hierro department store. Well connected to subway and metrobus lines. There's a large supermarket 2 blocks away as well. Everything you'll need from shopping to dinning or entertainment, is conveniently near as well as upscale gyms and yoga schools. The house is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of a bustling, exciting city. A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work or sightseeing.
<
neighborhood_overview: Stroll in Parque Mexico and Parque Espana, just 3 minutes from this apartment on the border of the trendy Condesa and Roma districts. These safe, attractive neighborhoods boast tree-lined streets, fountains, and many dining and shopping options.
host_about: HI!  I'm from New York.  Came to Mexico 20 years ago to play French Horn in the orchestra here.  Loved the country (still do), hated the orchestras.  I've been giving voice lessons for about the last 15 years.  Mostly musical comedy.  I'm home oriented, love to cook.  Do lots of yoga.  Love to be a tour guide to help people explore this amazing city.

Polanco is a great neighborhood to walk by.
There are lots of good restaurants, bars, shopping centers (Antara) and metro station...(Polanco Station is two blocks away).

Polanco is a business and embassies district and of course the best museums in town are located there.
If you enjoy jogging you can take a look to Chapultepec park or a track in Ghandi Avenue.

Polanco es un barrio genial para caminar, todo esta a la mano y cuenta con restaurantes de todo tipo, bares y centros comerciales (Antara y Carso). El depa esta a solo dos calles caminando del metro Polanco.
La colonia es un distrito donde hay muchas empresas, embajadas y desde luego los mejores museos tambiÃ©n.

neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest close to the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fa
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

The space
Comfy 1 bedroom apartment in a bright 6th floor apartment with a private roof garden in the âLa Roma" neighborhood of Mexico City.

The best part of this apartment is its location. From the balconies you overlook the famous La Cibeles fountain, where the turibus makes stops every 15 minutes. We are also within walking distance of La Reforma avenue, museums, monuments, restaurants/bars, metro and metrobus stations.

neighborhood_overview: The hipster Roma neighborhood embodies a colorful culture through stylish boutiques, colonial architecture, hip galleries and best spots eateries. Contramar is my favorite and itÂ´located within walking from my apartment, make sure to try Tostada de atÃºn ( Tuna tostada )
host_about:
I'm Marco. I am a graphic designer, but I also love photography, food, and especially traveling. I have been to a lot of cool places and met some great people, who have in turn visited me in Mexico City. I decided to formalize my "crash pad" and open it up to travelers on airbnb. After 6 years as host, I know how to make you feel like home away home and enjoy this great city. 
I know all different versions of Marco living in this city. From the designer that moves between companies and among idea-men, up to the runner that looks for parks and marathons. I know that I can be the dedicated host in Airbnb as well as the passionate chef that does not fear to take his guests to markets, palapas or little local and traditional restaurants.

If You are coming for pleasure, You should know that Roma neighborhood is a must for anyone who likes to know Mexico City!!

In the Roma You will find beautiful art nouveau buildings, with an eclectic and french style, housing wonderful galeries, art and design shops.

Walking through beautiful tree-lined streets You reach the Plaza Rio de Janeiro, with the "Witches House" and the Church of Sagrada Familia.

Main street is Avenida Alvaro Obregon with the cultural center "Casa Lamm", just a block from Plaza Luis Cabrera with nice restaurants and bars. Crossing the Avenida Insurgentes You will reach "Cibeles Fountain" and the market âGold Bazarâ where You will find all that you can imagine.
Enjoy appetizing drinks, from traditional Pulque and Mezcal to delicious gourmet coffee and a varied international and mexican cuisine. There are more than 50 restaurants located in the Roma area.

A few blocks walking You can catch the Turibus, which

name: PLAZA DEL ARCÃNGEL EN SAN ÃNGEL
description:
The space
Preciosa casa tipo colonial, ubicada en el tradicional barrio de San Ãngel, a dos cuadras del Bazar del SÃ¡bado. Calle empedrada, tranquila y con vigilancia. Buena ubicaciÃ³n, cercana a Metrobus y Metro.

host_about:
Me gusta ser honesta porque es lo que espero de los demÃ¡s hacia mÃ­. Disfruto de la gente y la armonÃ­a de la naturaleza y los espacios. La mÃºsica, el arte, una buena conversaciÃ³n, una caminata, un buen vino y la comida tambiÃ©n son muy preciados para mÃ­.
EstudiÃ© unos aÃ±os de arquitectura, me graduÃ© de sociologÃ­a con un posgrado en desarrollo urbano. Creo que la transformaciÃ³n del mundo generada por el sistema actual, exige una toma de conciencia y la re-construcciÃ³n de un mundo posible para todos y entre todos.
Lo que mÃ¡s me molesta es la injusticia y la mentira.
Me encanta bailar.
Viajar me parece siempre una oportunidad maravillosa para conocer y aprender sobre otras culturas que forman parte de nosotros mismos.
Cuando viajo me gusta alojarme en un espacio luminoso, limpio y alegre, ojalÃ¡ en contacto o cerca de la naturaleza, con vistas hermosas. No me gustan los espacios cerrados, oscuros y con demasiados adornos. Disfruto de cada pieza antigua (especialmente) o rÃºstica pero en equilibrio.
Disfruto en general de la buena mesa: la comida mexicana, la peruana, la francesa, la china; comer bien siempre serÃ¡ un buen panorama para mÃ­.
Me interesa la historia, los problemas de la actualidad, escuchar a la gente.
No tengo lema en la vida, creo que eso serÃ­a limitarla y desconocer lo vasta y misteriosa que es. No pretendo decirme conocedora de ella.

neighborhood_overview: La Roma district is an old and elegant neighbourhood, very trendy,  full of cafes, galleries, bars  and restaurants. It has been selected as the coolest neighbourhood in MÃ©xico City in 2018. Young artists have arrived recently to the area where famous people have lived. The surrealist Leonora Carrington, Fidel Castro, Jack Kerouac, Kati Horna, JosÃ© Emilio Pacheco, William S. Burroughs and Carlos Fuentes to mention some. I really love the history of this area. Many books and novels have been written about it. Actually, even when I have lived here for years, it surprises me very often because it is full of magic and mystery. A really enjoyable place. Have a look to my guide for interesting places to visit.
host_about: I am a woman who loves knowledge, art and culture in all its manifestations, which has led me to study, travel and live in different countries. I studied film history, which I consider one of my major passions, literature, theater, painting, drawing, philosophy and art history. Besides this I enjoy very much to attend concerts of classical music and opera regularly. Also exhibitions of art and photography. I like to meet people and share life with them. I appreciate true friendship and family. I love life, with all that it implies. I'm interested in meeting people who understand life as a journey of learning, wisdom and pleasure.

The space
This bright and stylish apartment has a minimalist dÃ©cor. It's fully furnished, has hard-wood floors, recently painted white walls, and frosted glass windows. It is ideal for the savvy traveler who enjoys the amenities and comforts of home while traveling.

This apartment has 2 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. The master bedroom has a new queen size bed, a private bathroom, and a huge closet. The second bedroom has a full bed and also a spacious closet. neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood, Colonia CuauhtÃ©moc, is the ideal starting point to explore Mexico City since it is walking distance to the most important historical, cultural and fashionable sites. Our apartment is a couple of blocks from the grandiose landmarks of The Angel of Independence and The Diana Fountain on Reforma Avenue. We are only a 20 minute walk to the Museum of Anthropology, the Contemporary Art Museum, the Rufino Tamayo Museum, and Chapultepec Park and 30-40 minutes walk from the Historical Centro, the Theater of Fine Arts (Bellas Artes) the Zocalo, multiple museums and iconic restaurants in this area. We are also walking distance to other great neighborhoods of interest such as Condesa, Roma, and Polanco,

You wonât need to rent a car while staying at our place since public transportation is readily available in our area and it's safe and inexpensive. It includes city-sponsored bicycles, subway, metrobus, buses that go up and down Reforma Ave. and safe taxis by phone or
host_about:
My sister Jennifer and I love to travel together and try different cuisines, meet new people, discover new places, learn different languages, and enjoy different cultures.  

In our travels we love to cook and not be enclosed in one room so we always try to rent a house or an apartment. This has made an enormous difference in the cost and quality of our travel experience. Since this is not our primary residence, we decided to share our apartment with other fellow travelers so they can enjoy our magical place and have a more pleasant and enjoyable stay in Mexico.

name: Best Views in the heart of Condesa
description:
This is a unique apartment located on the top floor of a 1959 apartment building of La Condesa neighborhood.
In 1957 we had one of the biggest earthquakes in the city. This building was very well design on structure by a Civic Engineer and has perfectly survived all major earthquakes in our shaky City.
In 2002, we did a major remodeling of the building. The Rasta Apartment has been designed with recycled materials and lots details in each space. It has a lot of light and visual finials to huge Jacaranda trees (Mexican cherry blossom by Matsumoto) and the City.
There might be City Noise.

2 bedrooms with their own natural ventilated bathroom. Extra toilette for guests.
3 roof gardens:
1st with thermal volcanic tile 20m2 (215SqF)
2nd with wood deck and lots of endemic plants 20m2 (215SqF)
3rd with natural grass 9m2 (96SqF)

1 King size bed
1 full size Futon bed
Linens

Blankets
Tableware
Silverw

neighborhood_overview:
The San Rafael neighborhood is one of the oldest and most famous, previously it was called the Architects' colony, it was founded in 1865.

During the Porfiriato, majestic houses were built, some survive. It is flanked by the two most important avenues of the CDMX Avenida Insurgentes and Paseo de la Reforma, by the Interior Circuit and the Calzada Ribera de San Cosme.

In San Rafael you will find the San Cosme market where you can do your shopping for cooking.

San Rafael shares with its neighbor the CuauhtÃ©moc neighborhood the famous Parque JardÃ­n del Arte and the monument to the Mother highly recommended on weekends since a large number of painters are put to sell their paintings or simply enjoy this beautiful park.

Life in San Rafael is very local and you can live the experience of how the defeÃ±os live in this very traditional and old neighborhood of Mexico City.

neighborhood_overview:
Lovely loft in the heart of Condesa, where everything is happening in Mexico City. It is a great safe neighborhood to walk and go out at night, full of nice restaurants, coffeeshops, bars. There is a bar next door, it is a great place and a good option to go out, but weekend night can get noisy. There are also two great parks just around the corner.
There is a supermarket four blocks away and if you are looking for something more local there is a market two blocks away. There is also a street market every friday two minutes away.
Great location where you have a metro station (Chilpancingo) and Metrobus station (Campeche) just in a 10 minute walk, Ecobici (public bicycles) just in the corner and also secure taxis in front of the building. Mexico D.F. is a huge city but here you are close to downtown, Chapultepec Nacional Park, the Antropology, Modern Art and Tamayo museums. You are also just besides Roma, Zona Rosa and Polanco, neighborhoods which are great cultural
host_about: I am psychoanalyst, mother and wife.  I balance my life between working and taking care of my two gorgeous children, a five-year-old girl and a two-year-old little boy. My husband Oscar is a visual artist and we enjoy our jobs, our time together, our neighborhood and our city. We love simple things;  like long walks, taking our children out, going to the movies, visiting galleries and museums.  We also like stay at home and cooking a good meal.  We try to follow the cultural and artistic life of Mexico, and that is why we travel every time we can, to meet new people and new experiences.

name: Beautiful Colonia Roma apartment
description:
The space
Beautiful apartment in Edificio Ajusco, an iconic 19th century Colonial building located in the heart of Colonia Roma (Plaza Luis Cabrera).

The neighborhood is know as the bohemian "barrio" of DF and has been the main attraction to generations of artists, writers and urban hipsters. The building is just footsteps to a number of shops, restaurants, galleries, parks and museums, and is walking distance to the happening Colonia Condesa, and within a mile to the charming Chapultepec park and Polanco area.

The building preserves its Neo-Colonial architecture and style with a mix of Porfirian, French, and Roman elements including its central patio, high roofs, wooden flooring, carved frames, and cast iron details, all within a quiet/peaceful atmosphere. It was pronounced as cultural heritage of the city by INBA.

The apartment was recently refurbished and features an open living room and kitchen, two bedrooms, two full bathrooms, a

host_about:
I'm Marco. I am a graphic designer, but I also love photography, food, and especially traveling. I have been to a lot of cool places and met some great people, who have in turn visited me in Mexico City. I decided to formalize my "crash pad" and open it up to travelers on airbnb. After 6 years as host, I know how to make you feel like home away home and enjoy this great city. 
I know all different versions of Marco living in this city. From the designer that moves between companies and among idea-men, up to the runner that looks for parks and marathons. I know that I can be the dedicated host in Airbnb as well as the passionate chef that does not fear to take his guests to markets, palapas or little local and traditional restaurants.

name: Modern Suite in Roma Mansion
description:
This lovely studio apartment is an addition to a 1920s landmarked Art Nouveau mansion. It's on the border of the fashionable Condesa and Roma sections of Mexico city. Safe, lovely neighborhoods, with tree lined streets, fountains and many store and restaurant options.

The space
The mansion is a pleasant 15 minute walk from the museums in the Bosque de Chapultepec (Museo de Arte Moderno, Museo Tamayo, Castillo de Chapultepec, the world famous Museo de Antropologia e Historia, etc.) A pleseant 3 minute walk from Parque Mexico and Parque Espana. 2 blocks from Palacio de Hierro department store. Well connected to subway and metrobus lines. There's a large supermarket 2 blocks away as well. Everything you'll need from shopping to dinning or entertainment, is conveniently near as well as upscale gyms and yoga schools. The house is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of a bustling, exciting city. A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work

name: New Suite in Vintage Home in Roma/Condesa
description:
The mansion is a pleasant 15 minute walk from the museums in the Bosque de Chapultepec (Museo de Arte Moderno, Museo Tamayo, Castillo de Chapultepec, the world famous Museo de Antropologia e Historia, etc.) A pleseant 3 minute walk from Parque Mexico and Parque Espana. 2 blocks from Palacio de Hierro department store. Well connected to subway and metrobus lines. There's a large supermarket 2 blocks away as well. Everything you'll need from shopping to dinning or entertainment, is conveniently near as well as upscale gyms and yoga schools. The house is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of a bustling, exciting city. A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work or sightseeing.

The apartment is brand new and has it's own private comfortable terrace, equipped to enjoy breakfast and other meal. The house also has shared open spaces to enjoy Mexico's mild climate. You'll find full sized bed as well as a sofa bed, and a large flat screened TV. A fully
neighborhood_overview: The property is a pleasant walk from the museums in the Bosque de Chapultepec. These include Museo de Arte Moderno and Castillo de Chapultepec. Closer still are Parque Mexico and Parque Espana, as well as Palacio de Hierro department store. It's a quick 20 minute Uber or taxi ride to the Historic Center as well!  Perfectly located in a tree lined, park filled neighborhood.
host_about: HI!  I'm from New York.  Came to Mexico 20 years ago to play French Horn in the orchestra here.  Loved the country (still do), hated the orchestras.  I've been giving voice lessons for about the last 15 years.  Mostly musical comedy.  I'm home oriented, love to cook.  Do lots of yoga.  Love to be a tour guide to help people explore this amazing city.

name: Descansa en la Suite de la Abuelita San Angel CDMX
description:
Beautiful, spacious and calm independent Suite on ground floor, fully decorated with Mexican hands&crafts, with a comfortable kingsize bed, 800 threads sheets. Small dinning room. Bathroom with bathtub. Kitchennette.
Free WiFi, complimentary full breakfast and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: dinning room, living rooms, roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, 100 years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of our floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervantes.
Our guests will e
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantas
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

Everything you'll need from shopping to dinning or entertainment, is conveniently near as well as upscale gyms and yoga schools. The house is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of a bustling, exciting city. A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work or sightseeing.

name: Cozzy Studio In Condesa, Mexico DF
description:
Beautiful sunny studio walking distance to the subway and rental bikes (ecobici), located in a little street in the heart of Condesa. Walking distance to restaurants, shops, gyms, parks.
Fully Furnished and equipped, new dryer-washer. Ready to move in.

The space
I have owned this studio for 10 years, and I have redesigned the interiors myself when I used to live in the apartment. Since I lived it I designed it for it to be comfortable, homey and ideal for long and short stays alike.

It is very well kept, very cozzy any time of the year. My furniture is mostly hand made, designed by me or chosen by me. It is truly a unique space to live and feel just like home. There is a beautiful collection of plants "inside garden" that makes the space feel very zen. Everyone who stays here always tell me they feels like home, (check out are great reviews!) and I always make sure to help in any way possible! I love hosting :) Welcome to your home away from h
neighborhood_overview:
It is a small street in Condesa, far away from the buzz of restaurants, but still at walking distance if you want to be part of the night life. It is a residential street. Very well located. The subway is two blocks away, and the rental bike station is just in the corner. The supermarkets, gyms and parks are very close by, there is a miscellaneous shop where they sell fresh fruit and other produce (cash only), there is also a few hospitals very near by for any kind of emergency.
This apartment is great for anyone who wants to live the true Mexico City experience without the need of renting a car or depending on one. Condesa is one of the hippest areas in Mexico City.
host_about: I like to host! Have always wanted to have a little bed&Breakfast, but meanwhile I rent my little studio and make sure everyone feels welcome and feels at home. I have a great attention to detail and like to make the extra effort for everything to be 100% ! I love to travel, and meet new people from all over the world. I have been renting my studio for 5 years now and it has been a great experience.

name: Descansa en la suite del geÃ³grafo, San Angel CDMX
description:
Beautiful independent Suite on ground floor, with a very comfortable kingsize bed, 800 threads sheets. Small living room, desk. Private Bathroom. Kitchennette.
Maps and documents create a unique ambiance.
Free WiFi and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, 100 years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of our floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervantes.
Our guests will enjoy our roofdeck Deck where many endearing friendships have born.
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantas
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

name: CÃ³modo Estudio del BotÃ¡nico, San Angel CDMX
description:
Small, very practical and beautiful independent studio on first floor, with a comfortable queensize bed, 800 threads sheets. Private Bathroom. Kitchennette.
Free WiFi, optional full breakfast and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: dinning room, living rooms, roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, 100 years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of our floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervantes.
Our guests will enjoy our delicious (and complimentary) breakfast with home-made bread
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantas
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

neighborhood_overview:
Going west, 5 blocks away, Reforma Avenue can be reached, with Hotels, Banks, restaurants an corporate buildings. With a stop nearby, you can take the double-decker bus service that makes a circuit form the Historic Center, Reforma, Chapultepec Park and into trendy neighborhoods, like Condesa, Roma and Polanco.
Going east, 4 blocks away visitor can experience MexicoÂ´s Past by touring the Historic District, known of itÂ´s beautiful buildings from 17th, 18tn and 19th century, the Opera House (Bellas Artes), the Central Plaza (ZÃ³calo) with its Cathedral, and the Aztec Arqueological Site and museum (Templo Mayor). Also the Madero Pedestrian Street with the Sanborns de los Azulejos Building, the Torre Latinoamericana. The amount of museums and historic places is endless. Also at a short walk you can go to Palacio de Hierro, Liverpool and Sears department stores.

description:

The space

neighborhood_overview:
Due to its architecture, history and cultural scene, Coyoacan is an out of time and space bubble in the midst of one of the biggest cities in the world.
Its bohemian familiar environment its very suitable for those looking for a peaceful stay, away from the city noise and chaos, while being very well communicated to the rest of the city.
Coyoacan was the first european settlement in the whole american continent, is and was home for many artists and intellectuals of all times.
Its streets are beautiful and green. Perfect for getting around walking, to enjoy the richness of its culture and art.
host_about: Singer, songwriter, therapist, love my culture and tradition, and like to share it with anyone interested. Love to travel around the world and meet people from other places and cultures. Glad to live in Coyoacan which to me is the best neighborhood in Mexico City.

description:
Small, very practical and beautiful independent studio on first floor, with a comfortable full size bed, 800 threads sheets. Private Bathroom. Kitchennette.
Free WiFi, optional full breakfast and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: living room, roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of some floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervantes.
Our guests can enjoy our delicious breakfast with home-made bread, organic Coffee from Chiapas, all fr
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Contemporary Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantastic new
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

name: Very cool apartment with terrace in Roma Norte
description:
Located at one of the most interesting neighborhoods, surrounded by trendy restaurants, art galleries and coffee shops. It's style, location and easy acces, make of this sun filled duplex an attractive option if you come either for work or fun !!

The space
THE APARTMENT
This Art Deco duplex is 1,300 ft2 and has two bedrooms, one bathroom and an office that opens onto a private terrace with deck chairs, a hammock and lots of sun (our guests tipically cite the terrace is the main reason they picked our place !!). Most of our furniture is restored original mid 20th century. The apartment's high ceilings and wide spaces make it fresh in the summertime, and its multiple windows let in the sunshine during winter. The kitchen is nicely equipped with everything you need to cook. Lots of space and style in the best location.

THE NEIGHBORHOOD
Colonia Roma was developed as one of the most elegant places in the city at the beginning of last century.
neighborhood_overview: Colonia Roma is a diverse, middle-class area, with markets, shops, and some of the most sophisticated dining destinations and galleries in town, plus mansions from before the 1910 Revolution. One of the city's best restaurants is only a block away.
host_about: We think Mexico City is a great place to visit. During these seven years Airbnb has given us the opportunity to help our guests live as locals and discover what our neighborhood and city have to offer. Just as soon as we have a reserve we send our guests lists of recommendations of things to do and our favorite restaurants. If you have a particular interest, we will be happy to answer your questions.

host_about:

I like that the guests enjoy their stay and their space, in total privacy.
My priority is to offer nice, clean, safe and well located place; at a  affordable rate.

I have always lived in Mexico City, I know it very well. It will be a pleasure to guide you and help you with any questions, suggestions that you require, or need that you have.

neighborhood_overview:
Mexico City is one of the biggest cities in the world, and it is not easy to navigate. If you are on a budget, the metro (subway) is great, but is crowded. If not, Uber works very well. Depending on how much time you have go to the following places:
1. Downtown/Zocalo ... get a compressed view of all things Mexican - Aztec pyramids, Colonial churches, ... try to eat at the "Azul Historico" restaurant if you can.
2. San Angel (Saturday)... go to the famous EL Bazaar Sabado (URL HIDDEN) , have breakfast there, walk around. It is a beautiful part of town.
3. Museo Nacional de Antropologia .. one of the top museums in the world ... everything about Mayans, Aztecs etc. ( (URL HIDDEN)
4. To supplement #3, go to Teotihuacan ... outside of the city but worth it ( (URL HIDDEN) )
5. Must eat some real Mexico City tacos. Ask any native for his/her favorite, go there.
6. Go to Coyoacan - visit the main plaza, go to Frida Kahlo's home ( (URL HIDDEN) ), have lunch at t

Nice and peaceful, co-living, co-working, traveling, networking environment.

As a 15 year tourist/service experienced host I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.

The space

You would occupy one of the guest bedrooms while the other is usually hosting another guest(s). Both rooms offer and are equipped with pre
neighborhood_overview:
The place is located in Colonia Roma, an âoldâ, classic, historic district of the city that has been turned into one of the trendy, popular, vintage, âmustâ areas to visit in Mexico City.
It is surrounded by parks, markets, all sorts of local shops, restaurants, street food, night spots, particularly accessible distance to other tourist points (museums, landmarks, etc), bordering to other trendy districts like Condesa, JuÃ¡rez, Polanco plus close/away enough yet not too far from old downtown (city square).
host_about:
Eager to host  and meet new people like you everyday and give my best advice about your adventure in Mexico City.
I lived working in the service/tourism business for 5 years in Playa del Carmen Mexico, a tourism industry focused city in the Mexican Caribbean, where I learnt the tourism business and met many travelers like myself and you.
From my experience working in the tourism industry and as a traveler as well I know first hand how helpful a good tip can be in regards to where to go, places of interest, where to eat, how to get around and the importance of knowing where to go in case of a health emergency and how to stay safe. 

I currently live in Mexico City, work has brought me back to the city where I am from.
As a local and having been around for nearly 40 years I know the city extremely well. If you need any tips on where to eat, where to go, how to get around, and maybe more important WHERE NOT TO, WHEN NOT TO, and HOW NOT TO make sure to ask. I want my guests to have a great time in my place, my city and my country.

Traveling and meeting new people is my passion. I have been to many places (not enough yet) and met loads of amazing people along the way. Been in the tourism/service business for nearly 15 years, in direct contact with foreigners and expats for nearly 25, so I can communicate and advise about pretty much anything with particular great expertise. I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.
Unless Iâm out of town or in exceptional circumstances, very few times I donât meet my guests. I've hosted around a thousand guests from all over Mexico and the world, with a thousand different stories. I will always be interested to hear yours, happy and eager to meet travelers like you and will try to make your stay at my place as pleasant as possible.

description:
It is a suite-type apartment, equipped with all you need to make your stay pleasant and welcoming. Ideal for couples and people traveling for business or tourism. The apartment is within one of the most beautiful and best located areas of Mexico City, in the heart of Napoles neighborhood. It is only two blocks away from the WTC and the Pepsi Center.

The space
It is a lovely suite with an equipped kitchen. The bathroom has a whirlpool tub, TV with Netflix and Amazon Prime TV, it has no cable or open TV. Memory foam mattress of the best quality. It is newly remodeled.

Other things to note
The apartment is on the fourth floor, the building has no elevator but the view compensate this. The building is monitored by closed circuit cameras, and also we have a maintenance person 24 hours a day.

The apartment is on a very quiet street, you do not feel the intense noise of the city. The neighborhood is quiet, safe and super well located. It is located in a strategic point from where you can reach the different points of the city easily.
You also have everything you need to have a cozy and practical stay. Dakota Square is two blocks away, there you will find a gym, cafes, shops, supermarket. Also, outside and inside the WTC, there are restaurants, ice cream shop, bakery, cinema, etc.

name: Entire Apartment in Colonia Centro
description:
Center of Real Mexico City, ( called "el Centro") halfway between the Zocalo and the Zona Rosa (20 min walk to each) Metro and Metrobus are 4 mins walk away. 2 double beds 2 singles. Lively neighborhood near Artesanias and Plaza de Danza. Please note: I will be traveling from the night of June 12th through June 14th, so please wait to ask about reservations until the 14th. Thanks!

The space
The apartment is ground floor, decorated in 19th century themes and art with modern touches. The bathroom has over 2000 ceramic tiles. From here it is 1 minute walk to Artesanias Ciudadela, the biggest craft market in the city, as well as the Plaza de la Danza (parque Ciudadela) where you can learn to dance salsa cumbia and even ancient aztec dances for free on the weekends. Palacio Bellas Artes is 10 minutes walk away. The neighborhood is safe: there are families with children out late at night (hence the only difficulty for 5th and 6th guests in the double bed in the
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very Mexican, with some buildings dating back to the colonial period. It is not at all touristy, except for the Artesanias Ciudadela (people staying in the zona rosa are told that taxi drivers or cops know of the best secret craft market in the city...and this is it) which is 1 minute walk away. Also the craft market San Juan which specializes in silver is 5 minutes walk away. Fresh fruits, vegetables and other food available at Mercado San Juan in Pugibet, 2 min walk away. Everything you need is within your reach, even the rest of the city/country: metro Balderas (both subway and Metrobus line 1) as well as metro Juarez (both subway and Metrobus line 4) are within 4 min walk.

This is one of the safest neighborhoods in Mexico City. There are working adults and children in the street from 8 am to midnight and it is very well lit. There are many businesses using the colonial idea of grouping together (plumbing tile and bathrooms kitchen shops in calle
host_about: I am a 64 year old high school teacher from Casper, Wyoming, USA.  Sometimes I travel alone, sometimes with my friends.  I enjoy different languages and cultures and speak English, French, Russian, German and Spanish.  I also enjoy experiencing these languages and cultures via travel, which is one of my favorite activities.  I hope to live in many different places in retirement, perhaps a few years from now when my daughter will be  in university.  To that end, I have an apartment in Mexico City and have a former cafe tabac in a charming village in the Allier in France.

description:

Other things to note
The apartment is not available to rent just to make a party. There is a rules in the building and is prohibited make noise after 12 pm.

name: Jack Kerouac's Cozy Den in Roma Norte
description:
Cool enough for Jack Kerouac to live here and write Mexico City blues back then!

A sunny penthouse with lots of character, ready to make you feel comfy and at home in the metropolis' coolest spot, that is Roma Norte. Feel relaxed while at home, and get ready to walk to Mexico City's best bars, restaurants and museums.

The space
This place belongs to the heart of Roma, is very comfortable and at walking distance to so many place that you won't even feel in - sometimes very exhausting - Mexico City.

Other things to note
The apartment is located on a fifth floor with no elevator. On the other hand, the climb will keep your heart healthy and help you digesting tacos.
neighborhood_overview: Say what you will, Mexico City is full of wonders, but Roma Norte is where you want to base yourself. Leafy streets, cool bars, markets, independent cinemas and international restaurants await you here. It's great.

name: Colonial Terrace Double
description:
Two apartments connected on a beautiful terrace in a 17th century hacienda in the middle of the historico district! Walking distance to the Zocalo, Bellas Artes, Cathedral, Torre Latino, and many museums and restaurants.

The space
This listing is actually two apartments alongside each other on the terrace of a 18th Century building that used to be a Spanish school for girls and was recently restored and turned into apartments by the Mexican government and the government of Andalusia (Spain).

Guest access
We only do check-in no later than 9pm at night. If needed, please contact us first and maybe we can make an arrangement with time and for an additional cost. Guests have full access to both apartments. The apartments have a separate access that is only accessable to them and three other apartments, the other apartments have an artist from Argentina who uses the apartment as his studio, a history professor from UNAM, and a small family.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is located in the middle of the historic district.  Just four blocks in the east you have the Zocalo, Cathedral, Templo Mayor, National Palace, and four blocks to the west you have Bellas Artes, Parque Alameda, Garabaldi, Casa de Azulejos, and the Latin Tower and in the middle plenty of museums and restaurants.
host_about: Hi! My name is Olivia Andrews! I moved to the historic center of Mexico City to be near all the major events, cultural activities, museums, and culture.   I hope that all my guests will love Mexico City as much as I do!

description:
Our home is a quaint and typical house of old Coyoacan. This bohemian neighborhood is just the perfect place to stay and explore the huge Mexico City. This house holds not only lots of Mexican Charm but an artistic family that will make your stay unique. Enjoy our place! Feel welcome !

The space
Ayuntamiento 70 B&B is a charming restored Colonial-Californian home in the middle of the very sought after and historical neighborhood of Mexico City: Coyoacan. It is offering a most dedicated service to all our guests in a clean, organized and secure ambiance. Each room has its own bathroom, quality bedding and linens and each is decorated with attention to the colors and textures of Mexican handicraft. The property is spacious and has terraces, garden, patio, a large living room and an impressive open plan kitchen with dining area.

Guest access
This house is surrounded with cozy areas with chimney, piano, lots of Mexican handicrafts, and best of
neighborhood_overview: Coyoacan is a place to be immediately immersed in culture, color and tradition. By simply walking through its plazas and small cobbled streets you step back in time. The location could not be better with its museums, squares, churches, markets and that special ambience of old colonial grandeur and indigenous charm that Coyoacan proudly presents. With the advantage of our close metro station you can get to the centre of Mexico City and experience all the wonders of the historic quarters, the museum areas, the vast shopping and later return back to the peaceful cobbled streets of good old Coyoacan. It is said that people who live in Coyoacan never wish to leave. I guess our dear Frida Kahlo could not agree more.
host_about: I am madly in love with my good old Mexico and all its charm. I direct a youth ballet company (Ballet Joven ) so dance, music, culture and cats are my sort of things. Welcome to Coyoacan, you will be delighted! Bienvenidos!

What I loved about this property

Just four blocks in the east you have the Zocalo, Cathedral, Templo Mayor, National Palace, and four blocks to the west you have Bellas Artes, Parque Alameda, Garabaldi, Casa de Azulejos, and the Latin Tower and in the middle plenty of museums and restaurants.

neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interesting museums. Among them are the Risco House Museum (Plaza San Jacinto 15) with its impressive 18th century talavera tile fountain, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum (Diego Rivera 2 and Altavista 4) and the Anahuacalli Museum (C
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

name: Great location, amazing neighborhood: Downtown MX
description:
A totally renewed modern apartment planned by me and my mom keeping in mind everything we both appreciate on our everyday space, it was meant to be warm, comfortable and chic and is also in a very central and authentic location (close to everything) in an amazing neighborhood: Downtown CDMX, just cross the street and you'll be in Mercado de San Juan (a gourmet market and a must), ten minutes walking from the historic part of the city, the hip areas are about 10-20 minutes from here.

The space
Fully furnished chic and clean with anything you may need to feel at home away from home. There's dark curtains on both rooms, laundry, working station, internet, tv and an equipped kitchen too.

Guest access
Everything on the apartment can be used so feel yourself at home.
neighborhood_overview: Authentic Mexico City at your doorsteps. This neighborhood is full of surprises, great markets, nice bars, near transportation, amazing food and whatever you may need, just cross the street and you'll be in Mercado de San Juan, an amazing gourmet market worth visiting, walk two blocks on the other side and find La Ciudadela, a great market for souvenirs and unique handicrafts, a ten minutes walk will get you to the historic part of the city and the museums area. Also Condesa, Roma and Reforma areas are 15-20 minutes away.
host_about: I work in hospitality and as a street food tour guide in Mexico City. I'm amazed by the power of shared economies and helping people. I love food, specially tacos. I'm in love with my city and all the things that has to offer and like to help people experience it in an authentic way, I also love traveling, new experiences and discovering all the magic that lies beneath the surface.

name: CDMX âPH1â in La Condesa
description:
This is a beautiful Penthouse in the trendiest part of Mexico City, La Condesa. It has a large private balcony, 24/7 security, doorman, parking, furnished roof-deck, elevator & much more.

The space
Nestled in the heart of trendy La Condesa, this modern lofted penthouse is the number one vacation rental in Mexico City. Designed by world renowned architect Michel Rojkind, the building itself is an architectural gem, filled with suspended glass walkways and twinkling lights. Inside PH1, you will find sleek industrial designs,Â two story ceilings, large airy living spaces, sun filled rooms and fantastic views of the neighborhood. A modern kitchen imported from Italy, two sunlit balconies, lofted workspace and beautiful Mexican artwork are just some of the many highlights of this prize winning loft.


(The Penthouse is approx. 2,000 sq. feet - 180 sq. meter)

The apartment is just blocks away from the beautiful park, Parque Mexico, which is at
neighborhood_overview:
This is by far the best location in Mexico City. right in the heart of the vast city, you are never too far from anything.

It is a very relaxed environment, one of the safest parts of Mexico. And about 20 minutes away from the airport.

Foreign influence is evident on the architecture in this neighborhood. beautiful colonial designs and art-deco styles. Truly a relic from another era.

The highlights of this neighborhood include:

A vast variety of restaurants/coffee shops
Boutique shops
Lots of green space/parks
Delicious street food
Adept street artists
Vivid nightlife

name: Centro CDMX base for work office or tourism.
description:
This little studio apartment is set in colonial Spanish surroundings and situated in downtown Mexico City. Minutes from the Zocalo, restaurants and many stores if you want to do some shopping. Close to transport links that allow you to enjoy the rest of what this city offers.

The patio has plenty of space to take in the fresh air. There are many food markets and retailers in the area open, many with delivery options. Internet speeds go up to 50mb: plenty for work/video conferencing.

The space
It's a split level studio flat, self contained, with stove and microwave.

There is internet, smart tv and DVD player.
Internet speed is 50mbs down and 19 up, enough for 10 videocalls in high def.

The queen sized bed is on the split level (see the photos), and there is a also a 2nd bed up there, though it is old.

It ainâ t 5 star, and the price reflects this, but if you want a laid back space and a location to really get know M
neighborhood_overview:
Centro Historico is open for shopping and includes a whole host of food/market services & deliveries very close to you.

You'll be staying in a century old building in the cities bustling and historic downtown, though far enough from the roads for peace & quite. Within a few blocks you'll have access to numerous museums, art galleries and a range of restaurants, bars and clubs.
There are also plenty of amenities like a supermarket and a food market within 5 minute walk if your on a budget and a host of street food that is some of the best in the city.

Downtown Mexico City is very secure due to the previous decade's re-development that brought the area its own police force.

The re-development though has not been able to completely gentrify downtown making the studio, located on the south west corner of Centro, a great place for a few days sightseeing in a more traditional setting.

You are also walking distance to the restaurants of Roma,

neighborhood_overview: The âCorredor Roma Condesaâ is one of the most emblematic and trendy neighborhoods in Mexico City. Actually it has been developed as one of the most important centers of culture and good food with nice restaurants bars and galleries. It is perfect for those who want to forget about the car and enjoy good walk or a bike ride. The zone is a âgreenâ zone with old trees and many parks. It is walking distance from Reforma, the most beautiful avenue in Mexico City as well as of the Chapultepec Castle. If you want to discover the zone, you will find many fine small restaurants to have nice breakfast or a fancy dinner. There are theater, concert saloons, and other cultural activities from early morning through late night.
host_about: We are a couple of physicians that want to share our magnificent and comfortable apartment in the heart of Mexico City, so you can enjoy it as we do. We like to walk around and enjoy the main attractions of our neighborhood like a good breakfast at âLa Ventanitaâ were we enjoy a delicious coffee, while watching the "Fuente de las Cibeles",  or visit one of the various parks and museums we have walking distance.  So come and visit us.

name: 1C - Suite Flores de San Angel  - 1BR/1BA Double
description:
Welcome to San Angel: Mexico City's most stylish and charming neighbourhood. With a tradition that goes back to our grandparents Juan and Cristina Solorzano, we look forward to welcome you into our beautiful home. Find your own green oasis in the big city by entering to our house and its lush garden. History meets modern in this fully equipped suite ready for your arrival (fresh linen, fully equipped kitchen), cable TV, wifi. For full guest reviews see: https://www.airbnb.ca/rooms/5750208

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. Recharge your energies at the end of the day or start with a cup of coffee enjoying the sunshine in the lush grounds.

Afterwards, go for a stroll on the pebble-stoned narrow streets of San Ange
neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interestin
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

One of the best and safest areas where you can eat well, exercise in beautiful parks and enjoy the nightlife, is two blocks away from an emblematic point of the city known as the Glorieta de la Cibeles. neighborhood_overview:
Colonia Roma has a remarkable Art Nouveau, eclectic or Frenchified architecture, La Roma is one of the must-see neighborhoods in Mexico City. It is a very safe neighborhood. You can walk to all the services you need, whether for tourism or business. It is very well communicated since it is close to Reforma, Chapultepec and Insurgentes avenues, where you will find practically any means of transportation: subway, metro, metrobus, trucks, cabs, bicycles, etc.
It is very close to a very complete self-service store, and also has a small market if you like fresh fruits and vegetables.
It is located in a cultural and gastronomic area. You will find all kinds of restaurants. You also have, walking distance, a beautiful park where you can walk and relax.
We are sure you will be very happy with your stay.

description:
Enjoy our beautiful spacious 2 bedroom apartment in one of the oldest and safest neighborhoods in Mexico City. Colonia Roma Norte. We are very close to interesting museums and galleries. We are surrounded by cool cafÃ©s, bars, restaurants, book stores, parks and wonderful markets. Take a walk on beautiful Paseo de La reforma Ave., to the east you will find downtown and to the west Chapultepec park. We are walking distance to several metro stations that can take you anywhere in the city.

The space
After you climb up the steps all the way to the third floor and open the door to the apartment, the view from the big window in the living room will let you know that you are home, take off your shoes and relax.

Bedrooms are spacious with lots of natural light and curtains that can
neighborhood_overview:
Colonia Roma Norte is very safe and centric, it is close to Downtown and to Chapultepec park. There are restaurants for all budgets, places to eat and drink, fabulous markets and interesting street food stands. You can walk to galleries, shops and on weekends you can visit the antiques and "tianguis" markets few blocks from the apartment around the Metrobus Parque Pushkin station.
Also NOTE that on weekends the neighborhood can be noisy at night due to private parties and the amount of restaurants in the area.

neighborhood_overview:
Colonia CuauhtÃ©moc is a colonia (official neighborhood) in the CuauhtÃ©moc borough of central Mexico City. It is located just north of Paseo de la Reforma, west of the historic center of Mexico City.

The colonia was created in the late 19th century after some false starts, and is named after the Monument to CuauhtÃ©moc which is a nearby landmark on Paseo de la Reforma. Actions taken by residents have ensured that the area remains mostly residential, with commercial development limited to the strip along Paseo de la Reforma. This strip includes a number of important buildings such as the Mexican Stock Exchange, the Torre Mayor, the Torre HSBC, the British Embassy, and the United States Embassy.

La Roma is THE PLACE where you want to be in the City, you can entertain yourself walking around and just sightseeing everything that will surround you. Explore and enjoy cafes, bars, galleries, indie shops, parks, bookstores and a diverse variety of restaurants â foodies alert: the top restaurants of the city are in the neighborhood.
La Roma has been known for its great location between Downtown and Chapultepec, and for the preservation of its architecture and cultural proposal.

name: APARTMENT IN VINTAGE HOME, ROMA/CONDESA!
description:
Lovely ground floor apartment with patio in a 1920s landmarked Art Nouveau mansion. It's on the border of the fashionable Condesa and Roma sections of Mexico city. Safe, lovely neighborhoods, with tree lined streets, fountains, restaurants & more!

The space
The mansion is a pleasant 15 minute walk from the museums in the Bosque de Chapultepec (Museo de Arte Moderno, Museo Tamayo, Castillo de Chapultepec, the world famous Museo de Antropologia e Historia, etc.) A pleseant 3 minute walk from Parque Mexico and Parque Espana. 2 blocks from Palacio de Hierro department store. Well connected to subway and metrobus lines. There's a large supermarket 2 blocks away as well. Everything you'll need from shopping to dinning or entertainment, is conveniently near as well as upscale gyms and yoga schools. The house is an oasis of tranquility in the middle of a bustling, exciting city. A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work or sightseeing.

host_about:
Hi!  I'm Juan.  I'm an engineer in computer science and worked for years as a consultant designing software.   I was born in Mexico city, I have lived in London, Sacramento California and Bogota Colombia as well.

name: Place in Condesa in the Chilaquil corner
description:
The apartment is situated on a quiet street in the heart of Condesa. It includes a huge living room, dining room, kitchen, a bathroom and an available bedroom. The apartment size is 100 sqm.

Condesa is the safest, hipster and vibrant area in CDMX. We try to keep the apartment bright with a unique soul with vintage deco. Move around by foot and explore the unique bars and restaurants that enchant the neighbourhood.

The space
The apartment is located in one of the most beautiful areas in Ciudad de Mexico, so you will feel fascinated and comfortable due to the characteristics and accessibility of the neighborhood.

The apartment and Condesa area have a vintage and hipster decoration, the buildings are more than 50 years old but you will feel a charming sensation.

Guest access
There is one available room, a futon, a couch and an air bed available. The apartment has no parking lot, but there is a parking lot where you can p
neighborhood_overview: The Condesa neighborhood is the hipster area of Mexico city. It has become a perfect walkable area. It has everything that you may need. Fancy Bars, Mezcal shops, night clubs, all kinds of restaurants of all prices and all foods. Supermarkets, convenience, and also department stores. Banks, galleries, yoga studios, cinemas, etc. Everything at walking distance. It really is a very enjoyable area. Additionally, there are two big parks where people walk their pets or go out running. The Chapultepec park is 15 min by walking. It has some great museums and it is perfect for jogging.
host_about: Mexican passionate about travel & sharing economy. Entrepreneur looking for a way around the world. Guest and host since 2014. Grateful meeting new people in different parts of the world and learning from different cultures. Airbnb describes my faith in humanity =)
