name: Spacious loft, private bathroom and kitchen.
description:
Spacious beautiful loft, small- kitchennett, private bathroom with shower, independent access from the rest of the house, I queen bed 1 full bed.

Two blocks from main square, walking distance to the market, Frida Kahlo and museums. Surrounded by shops, restaurants, libraries, theaters, tourist bus and bars.

For security :
External visitors are not allowed (without previous consent) if you invite external visitors this could result in being evicted or in the cancellation of your reservation

The space
It's a 90 square mts suite with independent access in a second floor. It has a huge window overlooking a central patio surrounded by balconies. A big closet and dressing room.

Two queen size beds, a dining table with chairs.
Kitchennett , all kitchennett essentials are provided. Coffee machine, a dispenser with drinking water, microwave, minifridge.

There is a laundry room on top of the house you can use it wi
neighborhood_overview:
There are so many activities you can do here. This is the second visited place in the city, very touristic but with all Mexico' s flavor.
You can find top quality restaurants, international food, but also mexican food. Many stools where you can buy any typical food a very cheap prices.
Artesanal market, food market. Libraries, museums, churches, coffee shops, Ice cream shops, bars. Tourist bus, parks, banks. Two main plazas. Free concerts. Street performers.
Ten blocks from here there is a new mall. Oasis Coyoacan, with all the big brand shops. Very beautiful, very American.

name: Bright room in safe, well connected neighborhood
description:
3 bedroom flat on the 8th floor of the heart of Del Valle. The flat has large windows and amazing views of the city. Your bedroom has an independent bathroom just for you. I love sharing my flat and getting to know new people, hope you will feel at home in this space.

Guest access
You are welcome to use all shared spaces: living room, large dining table that can also be used as a work-space, fully equipped kitchen and laundry room.

Other things to note
The flat is on a main road, which has many advantages in terms of transportation and services, but the traffic downstairs can get noisy sometimes.
neighborhood_overview: Colonia del Valle is a very quiet, safe and central neighborhood. There are many parks nearby, plenty weekly markets, supermarkets, restaurants and commercial streets; all within a 5-10 minute walk. This neighborhood is perfectly located for exploring the different areas of the city, all reachable through several public transport options and crossing safe areas of the city if you like to walk. The most common touristic spots near the center (Roma/Condesa/Juarez/Centro) are within a 15-20 minute ride or a 30-45 minute walk. The southern cultural areas (CoyoacÃ¡n, San Angel, Tlalpan, Universidad) are within a 20-30 minute ride or a 1-1:20 minute walk.
host_about: Artist currently based in Mexico City. I like traveling, growing plants, learning new recipes and having relaxed mornings. Interested in nature, archaeology and the evolution of cities.

name: Independent Room; Share Services; Near UNAM & Coyo
description:
Regular size Room in the lower part of our house which is near the center of Coyoacan in Mexico City.
We are within a walking distances from UNAM and 10 minutes away from the subway.

IMPORTANT: You have to be organize and have no problem sharing a space. And be extremely clean person.
1 individual bed, 1 work table with chair, 1 big closet with hangers, 1 bookshelf And a private bathroom
*You will have to share the use of the bathroom (WC and shower) and the kitchen with two more people. *

The space
Our charming house was built in the 50's by my beautiful grandmother. We have remodel around the house so it is nice for everyone. Our departments are great for students around the world and for normal travelers that want to know Mexico City.
Here is a list for our amenities!

-Kitchen fully equipped with cookware, dishware, fridge, microwave, table and chairs.

-Bookshelf and a big closet for your clothes.
neighborhood_overview:
Coyoacan, is a very beautiful neighborhood, it is very colorful and traditional part of Mexico City. We have a lot of museums, restaurants, craftsmarkets to buy traditional art to take back home, bars and big malls too. You will love Coyoacan for sure.

Our neighborhood is very save, we have security cameras all around and there is good lighting at night if you ever have to walk pass regular hours.

Me gustan los gatos, comer chocolate y hacer pasteles de vez en cuando.
Soy amigable, soy social e irÃ³nicamente: introvertida, valoro mucho mi soledad.
Me gusta ir al cine y caminar por la ciudad y conocer nuevas personas.

name: Great Loft Location
description:
Located in Downtown, infront of Central Post Office Palace, 1 block from "Palacio de Bellas Artes" and National Art Museum. Main attractions are few minutes walking. Great location. If you are more than 4 people please check the note. Building with gym, 24hrs security, ELEVATOR, Roof Garden with amazing view.

The space
Apartment located in one of the most beautiful architectural places in Mexico City.
This apartment is ideal for 2 people but up to 4 people could stay comfortably ( 35-40 mts2) . The apartment has one room which has a double size bed. One bathroom with towels, toilet paper and soap.

In the living room you will find a sofa-bed, the flat screen that has cable TV, WiFi that reaches every place in the apartment. The dinning room with a balcony that will allow fresh air to enter to the apartment. Fully and equipped kitchen, microwave oven, refrigerator and all the necessary instruments to cook and to eat in the apartment.

<
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Mexico CityÂ´s downtown so this will allow you to visit several historical places that are near the apartment such as the Latinoamerican Tower, The Fines Art Palace, Palacio de Correos, The National Museum of Art, The Zocalo and The Cathedral without even having to take any kind of transportation.
You will also find different types of historical buildings, museums, restaurants, crafts markets, bars, theaters, cinemas, parks, banks, etc.
For lovers of latinoamerican literatura, the AuraÂ´s house of Carlos Fuente novel is located in Donceles Street, a couple of steps from the apartment.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview: Condesa is a very trendy neighborhood (and I'm not just saying that). Tons and tons of restaurants and bars are within minutes (and seconds) away. Mezcal, tacos, coffee shops (non Starbucks), fancy dining and sushi are less than 2 blocks away.
host_about:
Hey! So, if you're reading this it's probably because we might be sharing a kitchen soon... I am a mexican actor (working actor! Thank you telenovelas!) living in the city. I have a pretty cool apartment with a lot of space so I thought it would be a good idea to list it here and meet people that I would otherwise never come across. I've had the chance to live with many roomates from all around the world, when I studied in NY, my apartment was like the UN, we had mexicans, americans, russians, brazilians and people from countries I had no idea existed... 

I have always thought I am a good host, respecting space and cooking breakfast whenever I can (I don't cook, but I buy a croissant from the bakery across the street like nobody else). 

This thing is telling me to put my life motto here but I'm not sure I have one so I'll just say I HATE bugs. Any other questions or whatever, I'm always free for a chat... :)

neighborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

name: Cozy apartment w/ patio in la Roma!
description:
Hi! We are Ilse and Diego; we are renting our cozy apartment in the middle of La Roma, trendiest Mexico City neighborhood. With high ceilings and white walls, rooms are distributed around a lovely patio. We are sure you will love it as much as we do!

The space
The apartment is one of 7 in a Typical Mexican Vecindad so it feels pretty safe and very quiet since it is at the end of the common corridor.

-1 bedroom with a double bed (fits two)
-1 living room with a sofa bed (fits two)
-1 studio
-Equipped Kitchen
-Dining room
-1 bathroom
-Private patio

All of the rooms in the apartment look into the private patio which is very special to us. Enjoy a glass of wine with friends or relax between the plants with a cup of tea after a hectic city day.

-Wi-Fi.
-Clean linens, towels for each guest.
-Iron / Blow Dryer.
-Everything necessary to make you feel as in your own home.

Gue
neighborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is a hip neighborhood full of countless amazing options for every age and taste. From restaurants offering every type of cuisine you can imagine, coffee shops, cool bars, parks and just about anything you'd want from a well-rounded neighborhood. It borders the very similar Condesa neighborhood, so add the two, and you have a huge area to enjoy.

The neighborhoods are also known for their amazing Art Deco buildings, art galleries and designer shops which you can discover by walking or taking a bicycle stroll around their streets, enjoying the characteristic laid back atmosphere.

Bilingual-bicultural hostess with expertise about Mexico City. Super location, 5-10 minute walk from museums, parks, shopping, restaurants, and transportation. Internet, cable t.v., once a week cleaning service, use of kitchen facilities included.

The space
Very clean, private, practical, and at the same time there is access to the host family if so desired. Kitchen facilites close by.

Guest access
Private room with bath. Access to kitchen facilities and terrace. Personal laundry services available with fee.

Other things to note
The location is superb. One half block from Masaryk, walking distance to all major shopping, Palacio de Hierro, Antara, Plaza Carso, museums, Chapultepec park, National Auditorium, many of the cities best restaurants, metro, public transportation and ecobici stations. Polanco is one of the safest areas in the country.
neighborhood_overview: The best of Mexico City right outside your door.  Walking distance from Plaza Carso, Antara, National Auditorium, Chapultepec Part, Bike paths, public transportation, Reforma Avenue, hotels, spas, restaurants and night clubs.
host_about: Somewhere between Mary Poppins and Don Quijote .......... positive, happy and outgoing.  Passionate about Mexico City and its surroundings ..... enjoy yoga, biking, cultural events and travel.

Close enough to major attractions and work areas, but not in the conflictive area where public demonstrations occur. Many car and public transportation easy access.

name: Beautiful Studio In CoyoacÃ¡n
description:
Newly renovated bright and cozy Studio located 10 min walking distance from Downtown Coyoacan, which is one of the most artsy, colorful and exciting parts of Mexico City. If you want to feel like a local but have all the privacy, this is your place!

The space
The appartment is decorated with with a mixture of traditional and modern Mexican design together with vintage furniture. Everything is new including the bathroom and kitchen. It's big windows make it a beautifully illuminated place with the advantage that no neighbour windows are in front, which is very difficult to find in Mexico City and makes the space very bright and still private.
The kitchen is equipped with all you need for basic cooking, there is wifi and of course clean towels and linen will be provided.

Guest access
Transporte pÃºblico: autobuses, metro, uber,bicicletas ecologicas. Salas de cine, centros comerciales, tiendas de comida, tintoreria, lavanderia y zonas
neighborhood_overview: The loft is about 15 min walking to Downtown COYOACAN, which  is one of the oldest and most traditional neighborhoods of the city,  with colonial mansions, art galleries, museums, shops and restaurants surrounding charming squares. The area around the loft is safe and you can walk or bike around until afternoon. In Coyoacan there are several interesting museums, such as Frida Kahlo's Museum and Leon Trotsky's House.  The apartment is also very near the National Cinematheque, with an amazing program of world and Mexican cinema, restaurants and book shop. If you bring your car You may rent an space there as the loft doesnât  have parking facilities .
host_about: I love my city, painting, film, art, dancing, learning languages, and cats. I enjoy to meet different people from all over the world and share my culture and stories with them. I also love travelling and sharing my space with travellers. Looking forward to meet you!

The space
We have spacious rooms with comfortable beds , closets , desk , hardwood floors and a shared bathroom

neighborhood_overview:
The Palm House is an architectural and historical land mark, originally built in the 1890âs and beautifully restored and maintained. Not only is the architecture of the house a rare fusion of colonial Spanish and French with 15-feet windows and terraces, the original courtyard offers a peaceful refuge from the busy city, with a variety of roses, hibiscus, berries, and of course, our Palm Tree. The rooms are spacious, with the original hardwood floors, and a large, beautiful bathroom with stained glass. Â 

The location is one of the most historic and safest parts of Mexico City, and mere minutes from popular areas such as Coyoacan, San Angel, and Ciudad Universitaria. The house is centrally located near a taxi stand, 24-hour supermarkets, parks, cafes, and a daily fresh food market. In addition, we are located close to subway/metro stations so that you can easily explore every part of the city during your stay.

name: ArchitectÂ´s Suite in San Angel
description:
Gorgeous and cosy independent Suite, with an extremely comfortable kingsize bed, 800 threads sheets. Living room. Bathroom with bathtub and 2 sinks. Kitchennette.
Art, books and documents about Architecture creates an unique atmosphere.
Free WiFi, complimentary full breakfast and daily cleaning.
Located inside our ArtistÂ´s Residence, our guests can enjoy our common spaces: dinning room, living rooms, roof deck with BBQ and fire pit (available upon request for you and your friends).

The space
When you walk in our Residence, with 5 independent studios or suites, you can feel the decoration of San Angel, 100 years ago, combined with todayÂ´s comfort.
During your stay, you will walk through our Mexican Contemporary Art Collection, of paintings, prints, sculpture and photography.
For example, the tiles of our floors were created in the traditional way in Oaxaca, designed by contemporary artists such as Francisco Toledo or Mauricio Cervante
neighborhood_overview:
San Ãngel is a XVI century village nestled in the big Mexico City: its architecture is lovely and still preserve beautiful houses and gardens, and its safe to walk around its unique small alleys and secret spots.

During the Viceroyalty in the XVI - XVIII centuries, San Angel was the perfect place for country homes to rest from the city.

Walking distance, you will find several museums as the Carrillo Gil Modern Art Museum, the Diego Rivera and Frida Kahlo Studio Museum, the gorgeous Ex-Convento del Carmen Museum, the Mexican Revolutions Museum, la Casa del Risco or the Isidro Fabela House.

You cannot miss the Bazaar del SÃ¡bado, on Saturdays... just 2 blocks away in Plaza San Jacinto, where local artists and all-around-the-country handcrafts market promenade is really enjoyable.

Other nice neighborhoods as Coyoacan or Chimalistac, and the main campus of UNAM (National University) are close enough to visit plenty of cultural spots as the fantas
host_about:
We are a mexican couple who has been together for more than 25 years. We have two teenagers: a daughter, a son.
We are in the IT business and we love to travel. We always travel as if it was the last trip of our lives. For us, family, love and harmony are essential in life. We enjoy contemporary art and we are dedicated to promoting mexican artists and culture in every place we visit. 
Pancho and I met scuba diving in 1994, therefore the sea, nature and outdoor activities are basic and necessary. We enjoy camping, scuba diving and sailing, sport in which we compete every month in Acapulco.
Lunch time is a special moment for us, a pause where we can enjoy and celebrate being together, a moment apart from the rush of the city where we prepare ourselves for the afternoon daily commitments.
We love Mexico and we are ambassadors of our country, we always talk about how great is the mexican spirit, its culture, gastronomy, nature, beaches and its history. If we had to choose another country to live, it would be Italy for the same reasons we love Mexico.
We recognize ourselves as entrepreneurs because of our professional upbringing, we generate projects and ideas, some of which become business ventures. We've always been motivated by the risk, investing time, money and effort to develop new ideas with a purposeful end. Another factor deeply rooted in our family is ecology and self sustainability and seek to have the least possible impact on our environment and our planet .
We have a francophile part because the 4 of Pancho's grandparents were born in France and married in Mexico . With some friends, we spontaneously create an amateur theater group fifteen years ago, "ThÃ©Ã¢tre a la DÃ©rive", where we enjoy making plays in French just for the pleasure of the whole process, costumes, learning the script and friendship. The group is composed mainly by frenchies living in MÃ©xico.
Today what bring us here is that 14 years ago, on a sabathical year, we lived in a "Chateau" in France countryside, and we opened 11 rooms to host our beloved...  more than a hundred friends and family members came to visit and stayed with us in that 12th century castle. The uniqueness of this experience led us to replicate the model in Mexico, and we open our home with a project: Art Residence to share it with you, people with similar interests, that want to enjoy living among art in our village of San Angel,  town founded 500 years ago and today immersed in one of the largest and most exciting cities in the world: Mexico City. Welcome!

In our country we say to our guests: "Mi casa es tu casa. My home is your home".

name: 3C Suite La Bombilla de San Angel - 1BR/1BA Double
description:
Welcome to San Angel: Mexico City's most stylish and charming neighbourhood. With a tradition that goes back to our grandparents Juan and Cristina Solorzano, we look forward to welcome you into our beautiful home. Find your own green oasis in the big city by entering to our house and its lush garden. History meets modern in this fully equipped suite ready for your arrival (fresh linen, fully equipped kitchen), cable TV, wifi. For full guest reviews see: https://www.airbnb.ca/rooms/5750208

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. Recharge your energies at the end of the day or start with a cup of coffee enjoying the sunshine in the lush grounds.

Afterwards, go for a stroll on the pebble-stoned narrow streets of San Ange
neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interestin
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

neighborhood_overview:
Napoles is centrally located making it easy to move North to popular Condesa and Roma and South to traditional and beautiful Coyoacan and San Angel.
World Trade Center is the main business center in Mexico City, only one block away from the building. Both WTC and Pepsi Center offer a variety of entertainment and business events, concerts and expos.
The world's largest mural, "La Marcha de la Humanidad," rises from the foot of the World Trade Center in NÃ¡poles.
Pennsylvania Street serves as NÃ¡poles' main commercial corridor, offering a nice and quiet walk through home-style restaurants and coffee shops.

host_about:
Easy going. respectful, friendly, reliable.
My first experience with Airbnb was in August 2014, as a guest, traveling to Chicago USA.
The experience was very good, so in September 2014 decided to join as a host, offering a couple of options and prices to stay in Mexico City.

I like that the guests enjoy their stay and their space, in total privacy.
My priority is to offer nice, clean, safe and well located place; at a  affordable rate.

name: Small room near Bellas Artes
description:
Small room in a late 1940's apartment in the heart of Mexico City. It's a few blocks from Bellas Artes (Palace of Fine Arts) and walking distance from ZÃ³calo (historic main square), with several public transport nearby and great to move to other parts of the city.

The space
Its a room with an individual bed and a desk. Enough to rest and get confortable. The space is thought for only one guest and in the apartment I live with a friend and my pet parrot "Pepe". It's a LGBT+ friendly space and we have the room available a few days a month to help us with the rent.

The apartment is a third floor and there's no elevator so we recommend to have that in consideration if you have mobility problems.

On the street are a few gay bars, on weekend nights the street get's very busy.

As a guest you can use the common areas like the living and dining room and the bathroom. The use of the kitchen is limited to store food

El nombre proviene del nÃ¡huatl y significa "lugar de coyotes".

CoyoacÃ¡n se mantuvo completamente independiente de la Ciudad de MÃ©xico durante el periodo colonial, en el siglo XIX. En 1857, el Ã¡rea fue incorporada en el Distrito Federal. Muchos de sus espacios han conservado sus diseÃ±os, plazas y calles estrechas. De su oferta cultural destacan los museos Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera-Anahuacalli, Leon Trotsky, Nacional de las Culturas Populares y el Nacional de las Intervenciones. El centro de CoyoacÃ¡n, con su jardÃ­n Centenario y su Plaza Hidalgo es un paseo casi obligado. Para irse de fiesta por la noche La B o Centenario 107 son muy buenas opciones, aunque El Hijo del Cuervo ha logrado convertirse en un clÃ¡sico de la zona. En 2011 fue designado Barrio MÃ¡gico del DF.

CoyoacÃ¡n no sÃ³lo es una zona famosa por sus bares, o restaurantes. La colonia preferida de Frida Kahlo se distingue por contar con una gran variedad de recintos culturales, como teatros, museos o galerÃ­

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interestin
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

name: Modern Mexico City apartment @ historic district
description:
Fully equipped modern apartment in a superb location at one of the most centric spots in Mexico City at the edge of the historic district and modern Mexico City within walking distance to major museums and landmarks as well as access to the citywide transportation system. It is ideal for a weekend getaway to experience Mexico City or to attend business.

The space
Fully equipped modern decoration apartment with superb location in one of the safest most central spots in the city at the frontier of the Aztec empire and modern Mexico City just blocks away from historic district and right next to major museums and landmarks at the business district. Location is ideal to visit both old Mexico (Bellas Artes Museum, Chapultepec) as well as modern (Polanco and Reforma avenue) and art districts (Condesa and Roma). Short walking distance from subway and public transportation including city tour bus to the rest of the city as well as various restaurants and bars.
neighborhood_overview:
Northeast is Mexico Cityâs âHistoric Districtâ which dates back to the 13th century Aztec Empire and thru the Spanish 16th century colonial age. At the Zocalo plaza, just a few streets east of the apartment, you will find the remains of the Aztec emperor Moctezumaâs temple next to the National Palace, the official government residence that thrives with artist Diego Riveraâs murals and the monumental Cathedral built on top of the pagan temple, symbol of Mexican religious devotion and Spanish conquest. As you walk thru the streets of the district you will experience centuries of history along with live shows, people dressed in traditional outfits, original architecture and amazing cuisine.

Northwest is modern Mexico City. Along Reforma avenue is the financial district with modern architecture and malls. Further west is Chapultepec Forest that houses the colonial age viceroy residence. Going west of the apartment there are colonia Roma and Condesa, which are considered th
host_about:

We strive to make the hosting experience beautiful, safe and stylish at an affordable price so that people that stay at our place can make the most of their trip.

description:
Ideal opportunity to stay at a classic Mexican style home located in one of the trendiest neighborhoods in town while living the unique home sharing Airbnb experience. Just a few street blocks from all convenient services: public transportation, the hop on/hop off tourist bus, neighborhood cafes and clubs, landmarks, supermarkets, bakeries, shops, and parks. We also offer airport pickups and a variety of safe, convenient and tailored door to door bilingual tours. Live Mexico city to the full!!

The space
Our home is welcoming, friendly and very respectful of your relaxation time. Best place to stay after a busy day.
The place is big enough for comfortable and independent home sharing. My partner and I live in a separated section of the same house, and we offer two independent and comfortable private bedrooms that include their own private bathrooms and the use of common areas. I will always be ready to assist you when required.
At home, we can comforta
neighborhood_overview:
One of the trendiest, safeties and most interesting neighborhoods in town. Close to everything you may need.
Condesa is considered to be one of the most fashionable neighborhoods in Mexico City, especially among young businesspeople, artists, students and others. Its character has been compared to that of the Soho in New York and the Latin Quarter in Paris. Its avenues are wide and lined with trees. It is mostly residential but also filled with restaurants, cafÃ©s, boutiques and art galleries. While the area has been residential for over 100 years, its âBohemian" character has only been in existence since late 1980s. Condesa has a number of examples of older Art Deco and Art Nouveau architecture, as well as innovative modern designs. Walking distance from main museums and landmarks. An experience youâll never forget
host_about:
Hello and welcome to our home.  Leo and I will be glad to share our place with you during your visit to Mexico City, and make you feel at home. We really like meeting people from all cardinal points. We have travelled to different countries and this is why we understand what you need. Leo is a dentist and I am a business consultant. We speak Spanish, English, French and Portuguese. Communication is not a problem. We love learning about different cultures and sharing ours. We are so proud to live in one of the biggest and most modern cities of the world. 
We like to listen to all kinds of music, attend concerts, visit museums and landmarks, watch all type of films, go to theater plays and in general take advantage of all the diverse extensive cultural activities the city has to offer. Come and join in the fun!
As your hosts, we will share special tips to help you live as a local in one of the trendiest and best located neighborhoods in town. Don't miss it!

SurgiÃ³ a partir de 1861, de la fragmentaciÃ³n de la Hacienda de la Teja, en particular del rancho de Santa MarÃ­a la Ribera, situado al norte de calzada de San Cosme.

AdemÃ¡s de muchas casas con alto valor histÃ³rico construidas en el porfiriato, sus edificios emblemÃ¡ticos aÃºn conservados son la Casa de los Mascarones, el Museo del Chopo, el Quiosco Morisco, Ã©ste Ãºltimo realizado por el ingeniero JosÃ© RamÃ³n Ibarrola para la ExposiciÃ³n Universal de Nueva Orleans de 1884-1885, el Museo de GeologÃ­a de la UNAM y la iglesia del EspÃ­ritu Santo, asÃ­ como el templo de la Sagrada Familia o templo de los Josefinos.

neighborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

name: Room 8 - Historical home, best location Roma Norte
description:
Located in the trendiest neighborhood, at CASA RM26 you will enjoy a peaceful private space. La Casa will give you an authentic and local travelling experience while staying in a beautiful antique house with a completely renewed vibe. Your host (me, Alejandro) will always be reachable and will provide you my local tips, recommendations and favorites spots to see, eat, drink and more. We look forward to hosting you!

The space
HYGIENE MEASURES

The security of all at La Casa is what matters us most, we have the following measures to provide a clean and hygiene space so you have the confidence you need and to make you feel comfortable and at home:

â¢ La Casa is cleaned constantly and our staff is always taking great care.
â¢ Hand sanitizer itâs available at the entrance hall, kitchens, bathrooms and other common areas.
â¢ All guests have their private space as all rooms are private.
â¢ You can do a self-check in without interacting
neighborhood_overview:
La Roma is THE PLACE where you want to be in the City, you can entertain yourself walking around and just sightseeing everything that will surround you. Explore and enjoy cafes, bars, galleries, indie shops, parks, bookstores and a diverse variety of restaurants â foodies alert: the top restaurants of the city are in the neighborhood.
La Roma has been known for its great location between Downtown and Chapultepec, and for the preservation of its architecture and cultural proposal.
ESSENTIALS:

La Casa has great groceries stores nearby, we recommend you:
â¢ SUMESA â Two blocks away from the house youâll find a bigger supermarket where you can buy all kinds of groceries. (Colima #115).
â¢ GREEN CORNER â Two blocks away from La Casa, organic and sustainable products (Merida #64).
â¢ ORIGENES ORGANICOS - 4 blocks away, it offers you a variety of the best natural and organic products. (On the corner of Colima and Jalapa).

DISTANCE FROM PLACES O
host_about:
-	Borned and raised Mexican with a global perspective.
-	Living authentic, diverse and enriched experiences give us the tools and knowledge to grow and add value to all that we do and offer to the world. 
-	Convinced about the great things my country has, looking to show others the greatness of CMDX.
-	Arquitect, Entrepeneur, DJ, avid reader.
-	Broad taste for decoration, aesthetics, history, art and music that I translate into La Casa.

host_about:
I am a very outgoing person. Love to meet new people and hear boring or amazing stories (we all learn from both). I don't appreciate people who are ungrateful but some times we meet somebody like that. I Love dogs and all kind of animals, I like the cinema and the video games. I enjoy travel around the world and make friends. I love my family, I love life and I try to give the best of me every day, I allways have a smile for every body, I funny, cool and I like and enjoy to be a good host.
My momma always said, "Life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you're gonna get." 
"You have to do the best with what God gave you"

neighborhood_overview:
Roma neighborhood was developed early in the XX century.
The urbanism features wide avenues and sidewalks with classic roman sculptures.

Roma district is currently living a renaissance. It has the biggest proliferation of contemporary art galleries, restaurants and bars in Mexico City.

If you want to go shopping, Colima St. has nice boutiques and shops.
host_about:
Not long ago, we envision a place where the architecture and design merged with great quality and service. Homes with soul, where people from all over the world could live a genuine experience of Mexico.Â 

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.Â

Welcome home!

neighborhood_overview:
Tree-lined avenues are characteristic of the neighborhood, art nouveau mansions and well-preserved art deco apartment buildings give the exclusive neighborhood of La Condesa a very special atmosphere. Restaurants, outdoor cafes, modern international bistros, taquerias, bookstores, boutiques and many more pleasantly flood the area.

Near the apartment is Amsterdam Avenue, a beautiful circuit full of vegetation that surrounds a whole area full of houses and in whose central area is located El Parque Mexico, created in 1920.

The entire area of La Condesa, along with the Roma neighborhood, was part of a hacienda owned by the Countess of Miravalle, who held horse races on her property, in what is now Parque Mexico. The hacienda was sold, and the urbanization developed little by little over time.

Parque Mexico was the first modern park created with an architectural design. Many of the elements of European gardens were copied, such as the ponds and walkways.

We have also included contemporary amenities for your comfort.

Flat is in a totally refurbished and charming 1950âs building, 2 blocks from Plaza Luis Cabrera and Alvaro ObregÃ³n. Fully equipped kitchen, wifi, cable tv, appliances, 24hr security. neighborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is the go-to place in Mexico City. Everything is walkable, and it's full of great restaurants, bars.
It was urbanised in the 1900s as an extension of the City Centre, and still keeps lots of original buildings (have a look at the local architecture guide in the flat). It has recently undergone an extensive redevelopment to become one of the trendiest and hippest areas. It has become a focal point for art, culture, markets, bookshops, and quite a variety of bakeries, local & gourmet restaurants and bars, gourmet shops & markets, without losing its local charm. Art & crafts fairs take place every few weeks in the area and you can also do some vintage shopping and visit art galleries. Even though the neighbourhood is full of great bars and restaurants it still manages to be quiet and calm.
There are 2 supermarkets, 5 and 7 blocks away, and there are several mini-supermarkets within 100 metres distance, offering basic groceries, fruit and household items. There is als
host_about: Mexican architect dedicated to urban development & architectural preservation. Keen traveller, art & museums addict,  foodie, wine & football lover.  I love Mexico City, I think it is a thriving & exciting city, with incredible diversity and variety of activities, and Roma Norte is the perfect spot to explore it from. Looking forward to be your host and  share with you all my tips of this amazing city!

Sink into a rattan armchair with a chilled sunset drink and take in the city's skyline from the terrace at a colorful, plant-filled oasis. Textured concrete, gleaming stainless steel, and glossy hardwood floors create a cohesive, contemporary look.

The space
One block away from The Diana Fountain and the Angel of Independence Monument. It is part of the tourist corridor known as Reforma - Historic Center.
Space is big, you can enjoy cooking and having coffee in the morning or a beer at the terrace. Tv with Netflix, cable channels, and Sony speaker so you can enjoy your own music.
Rio Lerma, it's a great street, full of restaurants and coffee shops. There are bike stations one block away. The department has excellent orientation, the sun gives during the morning and part of the afternoon in the terrace.
There is a gym just across the street "Reforma Sporting Club" with great service and a daily rate.

name: Cozy and centric room in a beautiful apartment.
description:
Welcome home, welcome to Mexico! This is my home, a space that I like to share. It is quiet, bright and welcoming, in the neighborhood you will find everything you need, bakeries, cafes, restaurants, authentic Mexican food and stores, libraries, parks, art, cultural and tourist spaces.
5 minute walk from well known neighborhoods like la condesa and la roma where there is a great gastronomic offer.
This apartment is full of life and made with love.

The space
Come and enjoy in this beautiful apartment full of light and love, my purpose is for you to feel at home and enjoy your stay and the city.

I share my home with other travelers, for now I no longer live here but it is still the home that I have lovingly designed.

Now guests enjoy it and it is a space to meet new people and share experiences in a warm and friendly atmosphere.

The apartment and the rooms are quite large giving space and privacy to each guest.

Around us there are vegan places, old and delicious restaurants, typical Mexican Cantina, cheap food restaurants, good cafes, bakeries, a park and an endless number of places of interest that you will discover.

La Roma has been known for its great location between Downtown and Chapultepec, and for the preservation of its architecture and cultural proposal.

name: The Mystique Owl, amazing flat @ Casa Quetzal
description:
Fall in love with one of the most iconic neighborhoods in Mexico City from this beautiful apartment, meticulously curated and designed with everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable stay, a place to experience the city and feel at home. Explore "La Roma" from this unbeatable and central location of Casa Quetzal and discover the restaurants, cafes, bookstores and art galleries that this neighborhood and its surroundings are home to. A place to discover on foot.

The space
Each of our apartments at Casa Quetzal has a bedroom, a full private bathroom and a main space with beautiful views and natural light where the dining room, living room and a perfect place to work from home are distributed. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to prepare coffee in the morning or cook a meal with fresh and local products that you can find in the markets and tianguis of the city.

Guest access
All the apartments in Casa Quetzal ha
neighborhood_overview:
The Roma neighborhood began its development in 1906 by the wealthiest families of the time who were looking for a quiet and private refuge but well connected to the city center, where their big businesses were located. It was designed with wide boulevards, squares, tree-lined medians, typical Parisian public sculptures, and eclectic architecture that combines styles from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. A perfect neighborhood to explore on foot and discover the spaces that emerge daily with innovative and creative proposals or to visit the places where the most recognized gastronomic offers in our country are found. Nowadays La Roma is in the center of everything that is currently happening in the city and Casa Quetzal is the perfect place to start your experience.

Check our city guides where you can find all our recommendations.
host_about:
Not long ago, we envision a place where the architecture and design merged with great quality and service. Homes with soul, where people from all over the world could live a genuine experience of Mexico.Â 

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.Â 

We are HOST ME TENDER, a team of hosts with a gentle perspective on hospitality. We are currently hosting over 80 homes in MÃ©xico City and Tulum. And it has been an amazing journey!

Each day we are more convinced that what we are doing is right because we believe that traveling is having the local experience and getting around many wonderful places. But by the end of the day, there is nothing better than feeling at home.

Welcome home!

neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. name: The Violet Raven, Amazing Flat in Casa Quetzal
description:
Fall in love with one of the most iconic neighborhoods of Mexico City from this beautiful apartment, meticulously curated and designed, thinking of everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable experience, a place to live the city and feel at home. Explore "La Roma" from this unbeatable and central location of Casa Quetzal and discover the restaurants, cafes, bookstores and art galleries that this neighborhood and its surroundings house. A perfect neighborhood to explore on foot.

The space
Each of our apartments in Casa Quetzal has a room, a private bathroom and a main area with beautiful views and natural light where you will find the living room, dining room and a comfortable place to work from home. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to prepare coffee in the morning or cook the purchase of fresh and local products that you can find in the markets and tianguis of the city.

Guest access
All the apartments in Ca
neighborhood_overview: The Roma neighborhood began its development in 1906 by the wealthiest families of the time who were looking for a quiet and secluded refuge, but well connected to the city center. It was designed with wide boulevards, squares, tree-lined ridges, typical Parisian public sculptures and an eclectic architecture that combines styles from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. A perfect neighborhood to explore on foot and discover the spaces that emerge daily with innovative and creative proposals, to visit the restaurants and canteens that offer the most recognized cuisine of our country or to enjoy the afternoon with a glass of wine from a terrace in front of the park . Currently "La Roma" is at the center of everything that is happening in the city and Casa Quetzal is the perfect place to start your experience.
host_about:

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.Â 

We are HOST ME TENDER, a team of hosts with a gentle perspective on hospitality. We are currently hosting over 80 homes in MÃ©xico City and Tulum. And it has been an amazing journey!

Each day we are more convinced that what we are doing is right because we believe that traveling is having the local experience and getting around many wonderful places. But by the end of the day, there is nothing better than feeling at home.

Welcome home!

description:
Our flat is in the heart of one of the most trendy areas in town. Everything is within reach for all tastes: restaurants, parks, sightseeing spots, art galleries...it's close to metro stations, bus stops and main avenues. It's an ideal place to move

The space
The flat is in a very safe building, we have 24 hour security.
It's very easy to move around: Condesa, Reforma, Polanco can be reached at walking distance, bus, taxi or evey by grabbing the underground.
The flat has 2 rooms. The main room has a walk in closet and at the end is the bathroom. The other room has its private bathroom right outside.

You can find absolutely everything close by. That's the reason I absolutely love this place.

Everything is walking distance and if you are a food lover like myself, there is always a new restaurant to go to. There is always something going on in la Roma. Polanco, Reforma, Downtown, are all very close by.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood:
Colonia Roma Norte, or âLa Roma,â as we locals call it, is one of the hippest neighborhoods in the city and has some of the best examples of art nouveau, art deco, eclectic and French architecture in the country. Take a stroll or bike around the neighborhood and youâll find everything from old-school bookstores and ice cream parlors to trendy clothing boutiques and amazing cafÃ©s and art galleries. There are great restaurants for every taste and budget where you can try the most traditional Mexican dishes as well as the tastiest international cuisine.

As for the nightlife, this might be the most exciting place in Mexico City, with fantastic cocktail and wine bars and even some speakeasies. Artists and bohemians from all over Mexico and abroad love La Roma. We promise you will too!

host_about:
Hector is a designer and consultant on sustainability, art and design issues. His firm belief about the multidimensionality of human beings has led him to study different fields of knowledge and develop his work under this vision. 
He is co-founder of BIOe where among his costumers and partners have developed a methodology to pursue habitat performance with a holistic view.
His interest in sustainability led to the creation of CUBE, an ONG with a tremendous growth becoming a reference on sustainability education with more than fifteen exhibitions and conferences in just two years since its creation. 
He firmly believes that everyone is an agent of change: a designer, and as co-founder of primal has been responsible for assembling multidisciplinary teams to develop design projects for companies as diverse as Scribe, Rothenberger, Televisa and Museo de Arte Carrillo Gil.
He is co-founder of âlimitâ a project which addresses the relation between workers and their infinite possibilities as human beings through art. 
Hector is a decided Plexant.

Entrepreneur interested in new technologies, art, architecture and design

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in one of the oldest and most historic neighbourhood in MÃ©xico and the walk around is delightful. Everywhere you turn you will see momentos of Mexico's amazing cultural past and present. The Coyoacan Plaza is surrounded by very nice restaurants and coffee shops, also delightful bookstores and artisans hang outs. On weekends it is the place to go to be part of the city eclectic mix of lively street musicians, mimes and artists of all sorts. The apartment its just a 5 minute walk to the Frida Kahlo Museum or the lively Coyoacan Market where you can buy all your fresh fruit and vegetables or even have the best "tostadas" of your life!
The San Angel neighbourhood it's also very near.

description:
Thank you for your visit! This is 1 of our 4 apartments in the same building, you have options to choose from.

In the Condesa neighborhood, 2 bedrooms, each with a bathroom in 65 m2 well distributed, each bedroom has 1 double bed, and in the living room 1 comfortable futon to accommodate 1 more guest and a nice terrace. It is a single level on the 2nd floor. Safe building, very bright and quiet.

It has Netflix, suitable for business travel, internet up to 200 Mbps symmetrical.

The space

Guest access
The whole apartment is for our guests.

Other things to note
To one side of the entrance to the building, there is a coffee shop, where the drinks are generally delicious. Very nice to sit and
neighborhood_overview:
Tree-lined avenues are characteristic of the neighborhood, art nouveau mansions and well-preserved art deco apartment buildings give the exclusive neighborhood of La Condesa a very special atmosphere. Restaurants, outdoor cafes, modern international bistros, taquerias, bookstores, boutiques and many more pleasantly flood the area.

Near the apartment is Amsterdam Avenue, a beautiful circuit full of vegetation that surrounds a whole area full of houses and in whose central area is located El Parque Mexico, created in 1920.

The entire area of La Condesa, along with the Roma neighborhood, was part of a hacienda owned by the Countess of Miravalle, who held horse races on her property, in what is now Parque Mexico. The hacienda was sold, and the urbanization developed little by little over time.

Parque Mexico was the first modern park created with an architectural design. Many of the elements of European gardens were copied, such as the ponds and walkways.
host_about: I'm a film producer based out of Mexico City. I do a lot of traveling for work all over the world to film festivals and other events. I also enjoy traveling for leisure.

neighborhood_overview:
"Condesa" or "La Condesa" consists of three "colonias" or officially recognized neighborhoods: Colonia Condesa, Colonia HipÃ³dromo and Colonia HipÃ³dromo Condesa. neighborhood_overview:
well. i prefer to share whit you the point of view of a guest:
Jorge was an incredible host! We absolutely loved his apartment and especially the location. We were on a great street and there were lots of restaurants, a natural foods market, a big fruit and flower market, etc. all within 2 small blocks. There is a nice fruit stand just steps away (I got 3 yummy mangos for 5 pesos!), a laundromat, tortilliaria, and coffeeshop literally right across the street. Also there is a vegan taco stand within a 7-8 minute walk. The location says Roma Sur, and reading the neighborhood guides, I wasn't sure if this was the exact right place to be, but it was perfect. We were right on the edge of Roma Sur which borders Condesa/Hipodromo and is just a few blocks to Roma Norte. I was able to take my dog to the dog park each day and listen to the musicians playing on the streets. It was a beautiful experience. Jorge made it so easy for us. He supplied us with guide books to the city, a great book

La Roma is THE PLACE where you want to be in the City, you can entertain yourself walking around and just sightseeing everything that will surround you. Explore and enjoy cafes, bars, galleries, indie shops, parks, bookstores and a diverse variety of restaurants â foodies alert: the top restaurants of the city are in the neighborhood.
La Roma has been known for its great location between Downtown and Chapultepec, and for the preservation of its architecture and cultural proposal.

name: Outstanding,  spacious, 3-bedroom gem in Condesa
description:
In the heart of Condesa, on a quiet street, the apartment features the most contemporary tasteful interior in the area, in addition to a highly secure and monitored environment.

It is close to everything you need: restaurants, shops, bars, food stores, parks with a children's playground.

When you book, I send my Welcome Guide with practical advice and tips about the apartment and the city. Past guests have found it very helpful to plan their trip.

The space
--Ground floor
--3 bedrooms, 2 with queen beds, one with 2 twin beds
--2 of the bedrooms have tables for work
--high speed WiFi, 200 mbps
--2 bathrooms / with toiletries
--living room, dining area and kitchen are all integrated
--beautiful hammered marble floors
--WiFi, English/Spanish TV, speaker plug-in for cellphone
-- fully equipped kitchen, with dishwasher
--dining area with glass skylight, also perfect for home office
--windows op
neighborhood_overview:
Eclectic, nostalgic, and beautiful, Condesa is one of the special treasures of Mexico City., recently voted the #1 city in the world to visit. Strolling under giant trees, centered on landscaped boulevards, access to bakeries, top-level open air restaurants, bars, shops, specialty food and liquor stores, are within easy walking distance.

Condesa is a mixture of Art Deco, Spanish and modern architecture creating an adventure around every turn, a place that offers a more gentle time along with the vibrancy of contemporary life. With two beautiful parks and endless variety, you'll fall in love with a local flavor that's old and new, totally intertwined.
host_about: Am totally bilingual, work as a translator and simultaneous conference interpreter. For years was fully involved in the arts: painting, acting. Then became a journalist covering Mexico for foreign publications, such as TIME magazine, the San Francisco Chronicle, also did radio for WGBH in Boston  Love dogs, taking long walks, good food.

The house facade remains as original form early twentieth century, only has 4 departments, despite the time the place is in perfect condition as new, on the ground floor is the kitchen with all the necessary tools, living room and dining room, some of the furniture that you'll find there, are original form the period. You will be able to find many activities on the day and night. It is located a few blocks from La Condesa, near Downtown and Polanco.

neighborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

It has become a preferred destination for national and international tourism and a privileged area of ââresidence. The area houses designer boutiques and five-star restaurants, as well as many cultural and children's options.
It is next to the Chapultepec Forest, the main green area of ââthe city, as well as the National Museum of Anthropology (MNA), Lincoln Park, the Museum of Modern Art, the Tamayo Museum, the National Auditorium, the Soumaya Plaza Carso Museum, the Jumex Museum, the Inbursa Aquarium, the Telcel Theater, the Siqueiros Public Art Hall, Paseo de la Reforma, among others.

description:
Clean Beatiful Apt. wooden floor, high ceilings, bright, large master bedroom with a large closet. Fully equipped. Quiet neighborhood, with the best galleries in the City (Kurizmanzutto, RGR and more!) Clean and beautiful. The building is quiet, there are only 12 apartments, families and young couples live here. Nothing happened after the 2017 earthquake.

neighborhood_overview:
The Mexico City downtown is one of the most interesting places to visit in the world, where you will find an inexhaustible cultural offer at all times.

The apartment is located a few blocks away from the Bellas Artes Palace , the ZÃ³calo (Constitution Square), Paseo de la Reforma Avenue and part of the most important museums of the city such as the National Museum of Art, Templo Mayor Museum and Franz Mayer Museum.

A few minutes walking you'll find two traditional markets where you'll enjoy typical Mexican food: Arcos de BelÃ©n Market (Salto del Agua) and San Juan Market (offering pre-Hispanic dishes, exotic and international products).

Likewise if you want to know typical crafts, you have only a few blocks from two great handicraft markets, San Juan and the Ciudadela.

Around the condominium there are a variety of restaurants and bars open in extended schedules, pharmacies, Oxxo and Seven stores (24 hours), entertainment (24 hours), shopping,

neighborhood_overview:
The borough is a classic area in Mexico City, located basically at the heart of the the city, close to the best and most trendy areas like Historic downtown, Roma, Condesa, Col Juarez, Zona Rosa and Reforma (Chapultepec and Angel de la Independencia), Polanco.
There are countless restaurants, bars, cafes and vast cuisine offered to all kind of tastes and budgets.
If you are interested in shopping, Reforma 222 Mall is just steps away.
If your visit is a business trip, this is the right place for you. The area is the financial district and is surrounded by international firms and embassies. (U.S and U.K)

name: Snake Room
description:
Welcome home, welcome to Mexico! This is my home, a space that I like to share. It is quiet, bright and welcoming, in the neighborhood you will find everything you need, bakeries, cafes, restaurants, authentic Mexican food and stores, libraries, parks, art, cultural and tourist spaces.
5 minute walk from well known neighborhoods like la condesa and la roma where there is a great gastronomic offer.
This apartment is full of life and made with love.

The space
Come and enjoy in this beautiful apartment full of light and love, my purpose is for you to feel at home and enjoy your stay and the city.

I share my home with other travelers, for now I no longer live here but it is still the home that I have lovingly designed.

Now guests enjoy it and it is a space to meet new people and share experiences in a warm and friendly atmosphere.

The apartment and the rooms are quite large giving space and privacy to each guest.

Around us there are vegan places, old and delicious restaurants, typical Mexican Cantina, cheap food restaurants, good cafes, bakeries, a park and an endless number of places of interest that you will discover.

neighborhood_overview: El Centro HistÃ³rico de la Cuidad de MÃ©xico no se puede definir en una sola palabra, si a caso mÃ¡gico, pero ni asÃ­ alcanzarÃ­amos a vislumbrar su enigmÃ¡tica personalidad. Este lugar se nos presenta como la escena de un mosaico en constante cambio de un caleidoscopio colorido en donde convergen infinidad de culturas, tradiciones, arquitecturas, corrientes artÃ­sticas, intelectuales. Visitar esta ciudad es visitar innumerables destinos, todos conviviendo en una curiosa armonÃ­a que se entreteje en sus calles, su gente, sus visitantes, asÃ­ como sus edificios, sus ferias, desfiles, marchas, etc. Son muchos mundos y experiencias en un sÃ³lo lugar, en diferentes instantes, pues de un instante a otro ya cambiaron esos mundos y esas experiencias se renuevan. Por eso nunca bastarÃ¡ con buscarle una descripciÃ³n, es cosa de vivirla.

Somos un equipo de gente experimentada que nacimos, crecimos y hemos trabajado en la Ciudad de MÃ©xico. Â¡Conocemos bien nuestro entorno y nuestra pasiÃ³n es encontrar soluciones y optimizar posibilidades para cada uno de nuestros clientes!

Nuestros clientes, mexicanos de todas partes al igual que del extranjero, son en gran medida recurrentes y nos han visto crecer y evolucionar a lo largo del tiempo lo cual ha ido retroalimentando nuestras habilidades y pasiÃ³n por servir, y son una evidencia de nuestra ventaja competitiva al ser capaces de ir adaptando nuestra visiÃ³n a los tiempos cambiantes de nuestro entorno tanto  como ciudadanos en esta rica y compleja urbe y naciÃ³n, y como ciudadanos del mundo en una constante transformaciÃ³n.

The area consists of three colonies: the Colonia Condesa, the Colonia HipÃ³dromo and the Colonia HipÃ³dromo Condesa, and is well known for its large number of cafes, bookstores, restaurants, galleries, and boutiques, as well as its cultural and nightlife. neighborhood_overview:
La Condesa. El mejor lugar para estar y conocer la Ciudad de MÃ©xico. Excelentemente bien ubicada y comunicada, te ofrece una gran variedad de opciones turÃ­sticas, restaurantes, bares, y centros culturales. Cerca de los mejores museos de la ciudad.
Condesa is considered to be one of the most fashionable neighborhoods in Mexico City, especially among young businesspeople, artists, students and others. Its character has been compared to that of the Soho in New York and the Latin Quarter in Paris. Its avenues are wide and lined with trees. It is mostly residential but also filled with restaurants, cafÃ©s, boutiques and art galleries. While the area has been residential for over 100 years, its âBohemian" character has only been in existence since late 1980s. Condesa has a number of examples of older Art Deco and Art Nouveau architecture, as well as innovative modern designs.
host_about:
Hello and welcome to our home.  Leo and I will be glad to share our place with you during your visit to Mexico City, and make you feel at home. We really like meeting people from all cardinal points. We have travelled to different countries and this is why we understand what you need. Leo is a dentist and I am a business consultant. We speak Spanish, English, French and Portuguese. Communication is not a problem. We love learning about different cultures and sharing ours. We are so proud to live in one of the biggest and most modern cities of the world. 
We like to listen to all kinds of music, attend concerts, visit museums and landmarks, watch all type of films, go to theater plays and in general take advantage of all the diverse extensive cultural activities the city has to offer. Come and join in the fun!
As your hosts, we will share special tips to help you live as a local in one of the trendiest and best located neighborhoods in town. Don't miss it!

neighborhood_overview:
La Condesa is 4 to 5 km west of the ZÃ³calo, the city's main square. The area is considered to be fashionable and popular with younger businesspeople, artists, students and intellectuals.
It's avenues are wide and lined with trees. It is mostly residential but also filled with a large number of international restaurants and nightclubs, bars, cafÃ©s, boutiques, art galleries and beautiful parks, despite the fact that it is mostly residential.

Condesa has a number of examples of older Art Deco and Art Nouveau architecture, as well as innovative modern designs, which give it an overall European touch.

Condesa was designated as a "Magic Neighborhood for Tourists" by the city in 2011.

Description:
Welcome!
neighborhood_overview:
Accessible walking distance, residential area, in city center; close to restaurants, cafes and shops; Spanish school, bookstore and beautiful church in the neighborhood; tree-lined streets, yoga-pilates studios nearby and jogging parks; Trendy nightlife; convenience store across the street, easy access to public transport networks.

If you love exercising and don't want to break your routine when you travel, you can jogging in the nearby parks, or go to a yoga studio or pilates (many places allow you to pay per class), even take salsa lessons!

If you want to learn more about Mexico, there is a library and a Spanish school a few steps in the neighborhood.

If you come to the city in a business trip, Reforma, Polanco and the World Trade Center are realy close. And you can make this business trip to a home experience. And in the meantime explore one of the trendiest neighborhoods.

Enjoy Mexico City!!
host_about:
Hola, soy arquitecta y diseÃ±adora de interiores. Me encanta visitar amigos y conocer nuevas ciudades. No hay nada mejor que estar en un lugar que te permita sentirte como en casa. Comprar deliciosa fruta en el mercado del barrio, conseguir hermosas flores frescas en el la tienda local, dar un paseo por las calles arboladas en las tardes, salir por un cafÃ© en la maÃ±ana o una copa por la noche, y siempre estar a la vuelta de la esquina. Esto es lo que encontrarÃ¡s en mi casa, tuya ahora. Muy emocionada de ser parte de esta comunidad.

Hello, I am an architect and interior designer. I love visiting friends and meet new cities. After staying with Air bnb and live the experience, I have decided to become host, besides being a traveler. There is nothing better than stay at a place that allows you to feel the "home" experience. Buy delicious fruit at neighborhood's market, get beautifull fresh flowers with the local vendor, take a walk on the tree-lined streets in the evenings, go out for a coffe in the morning or a drink at night, and always be just around the corner. This is what you'll find in my house, yours now. Very exciting to be part of this community.

We take great pride in our attention to details for our guests, whatever your reason for visiting may be, we want you to feel comfortable and welcome in our homes.
This apartment has been designed and crafted using local products manufactured to a supremely high standard by Mexican designers and artisans. You won't find any Ikea here.

The artworks, handcrafted objects and fabrics are from a combination of Mexican & British artists, and we would be happy to share further details about any particular piece, including contact details or if you are in a rush and would like a piece to take home with you we welcome you to purchase directly from us.

In the bedrooms we use Luunaâ¢ tempurpedic mattresses and 500 thread-count Egyptian cottons for a truly wonderful sleep. Each bedroom has it's own distinct style, from the sensual master bedroom to the more playful second bedroom.

The bathrooms are fully equipped with a excellent quality shampoos, cond

name: Room 2 House of Light and Color in Coyoacan
description:
The house is located inside a gated community, a calm oasis in the busy Mexico City. It is located a block away form the UNAM, and two blocks away from the METRO. This very sonny and comfortable Room is located in the first floor of the House of Light and Color in Coyoacan. Two tween beds, a wide closet, desk and chairs for your comfort.

The space
Tween beds. Big desk. Large closet. A nice window with a lot of trees to look at. The bathroom is outside the room and is occasionally shared.

Guest access
The entire first floor of the house is open to our guests. Kitchen, dinning and living rooms are colorful and spacious. The T.V. room provides a comfortable area for you to use with a desk and appliances connections if you want to browse on your computer. name: Modern, Industrial Apartment with Bamboo Garden
description:
Fully renovated in August! Here you'll be able to stretch out in a hammock in the quiet Zen courtyard of this industrial apartment, and enjoy tranquility in a contemporary space outfitted with Mexican-designed furniture and decor, rustic finishes, and access to a rooftop with a beautiful green view. In the best location of one of the most beautiful and exclusive neighborhoods in the city, La Condesa; we're a few steps away from Parque MÃ©xico.

It is one of the most fashionable and trendy neighborhoods; full of artists, students, and intellectuals. Easy access from the main streets of the city and a couple of blocks away from Parque MÃ©xico and Parque EspaÃ±a makes this place the perfect location to start exploring the city. host_about:
Not long ago, we envision a place where the architecture and design merged with great quality and service. Homes with soul, where people from all over the world could live a genuine experience of Mexico.Â 

We decided that we had to design these homes with everything you need to enjoy your vacation or to inspire you and take your work to a magical place away from home. We took care of every detail so each space could fulfill your needs.Â 

We are HOST ME TENDER, a team of hosts with a gentle perspective on hospitality. We are currently hosting over 80 homes in MÃ©xico City and Tulum. And it has been an amazing journey!

Each day we are more convinced that what we are doing is right because we believe that traveling is having the local experience and getting around many wonderful places. But by the end of the day, there is nothing better than feeling at home.

Welcome home!

name: Gorgeous Condesa House with Beautiful Private Garden
description:
This gorgeous, recently renovated 1920's home features its own private garden, a welcome green oasis in the bustling metropolis of Mexico City. Spend the morning exploring the neighborhood, then retire for a siesta or afternoon coffee on the terrace.

This house is the residence of a travel writer and her partner, a renowned Spanish artist. Once owned by Mexicoâs Secretary of Education, Jaime Torres Bodet (a founder of our world famous Anthropology Museum) it has been painstakingly restored by the current owners in keeping with the true essence of the property, while adding a personal touch with furniture, objects and art they have collected from all over the world.

This is one of the few houses in Mexico with European central heating. ( a must to have during winter )

The house has two stories and a mezzanine. On the main floor is the living room with original chimney and wood floors, kitchen, and dining room that seats 8 people and looks onto a peace
neighborhood_overview: La Condesa is one of Mexico City's most beautiful, trendy, and safe neighborhoods. This gorgeous house sits on a quiet, tree-lined street with multiple museums, parks, art galleries, and restaurants all within walking distance.
host_about:
I am an inveterate world traveler and culture vulture. I travel for pleasure and work (writing, collecting local art, antiques, and crafts for shops and museums) I love yoga, scuba diving, art, local food, exploring museums, indigenous art, and hiking with my rescued dog Jet. I divide my time between Madrid, Los Angeles,  Mexico City, and the world.
  My style of traveling is staying in a historical building or a beautiful home with the local touch.   I love classical music, jazz, Cuban, ethnic music. I love reading local authors of the places where I go.  I like living a healthy life style.

name: Amazing apartment with balcony
description:
Building from 2006 clean, safe and located in a prime site at historical Roma Sur, surrounded by prime areas like Condesa, Del Valle and Roma Norte

Apartment was totally renovated in May 2016. Everything is new and totally adapted for Airbnb guests. It has a fully equipped kitchen with microwave, refrigerator, stove. There are two independent rooms, each one with a full bed and a large closet. There is also a large living room with a sofa and a brand new smart TV with Netflix.

There is one full bathroom with a shower that has a tempered glass door, another half bathroom with enough space to store your beauty Items. Both bathrooms have hairdryers and soap dispensers

There is also a balcony with a table and two garden chairs for you to enjoy the evening breeze

The apartment is on the first floor but the building has an elevator in case you carry heavy luggage or donât want to use the stairs

Building is very safe, it has a doorman o
neighborhood_overview: The area is very peaceful and has many options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Two blocks from the apartment there is a small supermarket. Only 1 block from the building is a Metrobus station that leads to downtown in a short time.
host_about:
I have been working for multinational companies for more than 15 years, and have had the chance to meet and learn from  amazing people from other cultures and places. 

I am in love with Mexico. I believe this is one of the most amazing countries in the world, it has a lot of places to visit, nature, culture, architecture, delicious food, history, but most important, it has thousands of people that understand how important is to take good care of our visitors, since tourism is the second source of income for this country. 

I enjoy being a host. It makes me very happy to see my visitors well taken care off. I love for people from all over the world to come and visit this amazing city, and stay in my place.   Airbnb has distinguished myself with the super host category, as quality and service are really important for me. 

My hobbies are photography, traveling, reading and running.

TV with Netflix and Sat Tv, Bluetooth speaker with CD and AM and FM radio, well equipped kitchen and dining table, High Speed internet (30 MB/s), big safe (can fit your laptop), amenities (shampoo, soap, hand cream, etc..). neighborhood_overview:
Del Valle is a very charming area. It is next to Condesa and Roma neighborhoods, so its a chic and social zone, with good restaurants, but continues the feeling traditional old Mexico, with families and pets walking around. The area is full of options for all people, you can walk or use the public transport.
Next to must sight sites in Mexico City like Historic Center (Colonial and Prehispanic area), Condesa borough (historic houses), Roma borough (nice restaurants), Coyoacan (Frida Khalo museum), Reforma (financial district), Parks Alameda and Chapultepec (real castle in the central park of city) and San Angel (exconvent).
Del Valle is one of the last neighborhoods on the core of the city that still has a lot of old and original houses, the old houses of the neighborhoods around were replaced by modern buildings.

Del valle es una colonia agradable, estÃ¡ cerca de la Condesa, por lo que es una zona chic y social con buenos restaurantes, pero, mantiene la tradiciÃ³n

The space

The kitchen opens up into a living room which has a sofa bed and 43-inch smart TV (Netflix included) with unbeatable views of the city. There is also a modern bathroom with a glass shower.

Enjoy a loft style space located just a block away from the World Trade Center. Perfect for a business trip, a coupleÂ´s trip or just your adventurer self. With restaurants, movie theatres, banks, bars and the famous cultural center of muralist David Alfaro Siqueiros walking distance! The building has a 24 hr doorman, 1 parking space and an elevator. The apt is located on the first floor and has great natural light. ItÂ´s near the metrobus, subway and ecobikes to take a tour around the city.

The space
What makes this apartment special, is that it has a lot of natural light. ItÂ´s also very comfortable, since it's on a first floor, so there is no need to be waiting for the elevator if you donÂ´t have the time. You can go in & out easily all day. It's perfect for 1 or 2 people.
