neighborhood_overview:
The amazing thing about being a block away from the World Trade Center, is that, you have all kids of places at a walking distance: movie theatres, shopping centers, restaurants, bars, banks, currency exchange offices, pharmacies, beauty salons, dry cleaners, coffee shops such as Starbucks, Cielito Querido CafÃ© (the mexican version of Starbucks), Amsterdam Coffee Shop, the Pepsi Center & the cultural center Polyforum Siqueiros (which you have to visit!)

Itâs the perfect point to stay in the city, because you will be near the trendiest neighborhoods such as La Roma, La Condesa, youâll be 15 minutes away from San Angel (where the Diego Rivera & Frida Kahlo studio museum is located) & a 20 min drive away from Polanco.

The neighborhood is safe and peaceful.

Also, on Sundays, you will have within your reach, a typical market which offers the best fruit you have ever tasted, traditional Mexican food and an endless variety of items at the best prices.
host_about:

I'm a fashion designer, fashion stylist, movie buff & a music lover. 

Mexico's capital  is a city full of life, history, art, warmth, music & color. 

Sunny San Diego  has unbeatable weather which is ideal for outdoor activities & is the best city to relax while discovering it's beautiful beaches. 

You will never be bored in neither one. 

 I would love to help you feel at home away from home & to discover these two very different & amazing cities!

Welcome home!

name: 3 STORY TOWNHOUSE in the HEART of COYOACAN!
description:
Our casita is located in the beautiful and historical Coyoacan. Home to the greatest artists, Coyoacan is safe, quiet and perfect for walking and biking. Our house is very close to delicious restaurants, fun bars, markets, parks, subway stations and the famous Frida Kahlo museum. The neighbourhood is full of Mexican art and culture and the house is cozy and lovely! Our casita is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and well behaved furry friends (pets).

The space
Our 3 story Mexican house is on a quiet street. We've done our best to make it comfortable, very clean and cute for you. The living room space is cozy, the kitchen is fully equipped, the bedrooms are comfortable and the terrace is a great space to read, take a nap or sunbathe. We hope you can feel at home and enjoy your stay.

1st floor: One half bathroom. Fully equipped Kitchen with brand new fridge, oven and nespresso machine. TV Room with Cable and NE
neighborhood_overview:
Our cute house is located in the first neighbourhood of Mexico City, the beautiful and historical Coyoacan. Home to the greatest artists, including Frida Kahlo, Coyoacan is safe, quiet and perfect for walking and riding a bike. Our casita is two blocks away from the main square where you'll find tons of delicious restaurants and bars, both traditional and upscale. The house is also two blocks away from the Coyoacan farmer's market (open everyday) and four blocks away from the Frida Kahlo museum. There's several parks in the area including the "viveros" which is also two blocks away and has running trails.
Youâll love our place because the neighbourhood is full of Mexican art and culture and the place has great ambiance.
host_about: My boyfriend Stacy and I work in the film industry. We own this house together and used to live there before we decided to move out and become AirBnB hosts. We love film, animals, biking, hiking, reading, traveling and eating nice vegan food. Since we travel so much we know what it is like wanting to stay somewhere really nice but yet comfy and homey. We decided to decorate our Casita in a warm and cozy way, with all the amenities to make you feel like you live there but also as practical and comfortable as a hotel room. We will always do our best to accommodate your needs because we want to make sure you're happy and relaxed!

description:
Beautiful house in the Condesa, built in 1937. Recently restored and redecorated.
It has five bedrooms, three bathrooms and all services. Fully functional. Located in a very quiet street, but conveniently close to all kinds of restaurants, bars, cafes and beautiful parks, among many other attractions. Great for families or groups of friends up to 10 guests.

The space
The house has 5 bedrooms, 4 of them with king size beds and the remaining one with a queen size bed. All rooms have closets and safety box.
Four rooms have a work table.
In the common area we have a desk with multiple drawers, to work comfortably.
A full bathroom with toilet, sink and shower on the ground floor and 2 full bathrooms also upstairs.
Full kitchen including gas oven and laundry center.

Guest access
The house is absolutely private for the guests. You can access the backyard and enjoy the garden table.
neighborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the most beautiful and historic neighborhoods in Mexico City. Here you will find beautiful parks, streets and buildings more than 100 years old.
The variety of alternatives to eat is amazing, from the local market to the most renowned restaurants.
And for me, the most incredible thing: You have all this just a few steps away, enjoying at the same time that you are in a house located in a quiet and nostalgic street.
host_about: I'm from Monterrey, Mexico. I like reading, biking, going to the movies and enjoy a good chat.

name: 5 min to CDMX airport
description:

The space
Its a private and independent room inside our house with direct comunication to the street crossing a hall that does not inferfere with the entrance of other apartments. It has a clean and comfortable bathroom with hot water.

Guest access
There is a patio with a garden table (old Mexican style which is now in remodelation in order to have a nice space to have some tea or coffee). You can use it as you want.

Other things to note
The most important is the close distance from the airport.

neighborhood_overview:
This is a very safety and beautiful zone, heavily guarded by police. There are a few diplomatic embassies around, including the U.S.A. embassy. With many tourist places to visit in a safety zone such as museums, bars, restaurants and the best areas of Mexico just a few steps from you.

There are a lot of museums close by, for example The Anthropology Museum, Modern art Museum, Tamayo Museum, Chapultepec Castle, Nacional History Museum, Papalote (a museum for children) and much more a short drive away.

There is also the Chapultepec Zoo, different kind of Parks, cycle tracks, the most important and historical avenue, "Paseo de la Reforma", the Angel of Independence, important hotels and restaurants and cafe shops, all of this in walking distance.

name: Unconventional place in the heart of Mexico City
description:
Roomy bohemian-style apartment with astonishing view, near to Bellas Artes Palace. It is near from museums, theaters, events, restaurants and bars. Places of interest: Museo Nacional De Arte, Museo Franz Mayer, Plaza de Garibaldi. My place is perfect for adventurers , couples, singles, musicians, artist designers, architects and so. IMPORTANT: The apartment is on the 5th floor of an age-old building without an elevator.

The space
This refurbished apartment is on the 5th floor of an age-old building without an elevator, so besides the amazing view of the city you will also strengthen your legs and improve fitness going up the stairs.

Entering the apartment you will see a roomy, well-lit area with the living room, the kitchen and the dining room. You can find a toilet and the washing room near the front door; next to the kitchen is the bedroom and in it you will find the bathroom.

The wooden floor is old, so it has worn away over time and has
neighborhood_overview:
Mexico City is called âThe City of Palacesâ and most of these palaces are in downtown, making it a stunning area to stay.

Almost on every block you will find historical places with different architectural styles, some of them are museums, theaters, churches or restaurants and a few government offices. You may want to take some walking tours with local guides who tell stories about the neighborhood, buildings and streets; also if you like Mexican food and drinking you can tour older restaurants and cantinas.

You can find many places to eat and drink, from street food and cantinas to sophisticated restaurants and bars, from typical Mexican food to Mexican signature cuisine and international cuisine; the prices correspond to the kind of place you choose to eat. Of course there is a market with really good and fresh food if you prefer to make dinner yourself.

Also, the city center has always been a commercial area, you can find many stores with all kinds

neighborhood_overview: Tlatelolco is located near the centre of Mexico City. Its iconic square is bounded by an excavated Aztec archaeological site, the 17th-century church designed by Fray Juan de Torquemada and dedicated to St James the Great (known as Santiago de Tlatelolco), the remains of a former Franciscan convent to which was formerly attached the Colegio de Santa Cruz de Tlatelolco, and an office complex that used to belong to the Ministry of Foreign Relations and is now the property of the National Autonomous University of Mexico.

description:
The room is recently remodeled to offer a cool alternative to the boring dull rooms that I see around. I've stayed in hotels and I really hate lying on my bed tired at night just to watch local TV. 3 km away from the Botanical Garden and the Lake and grounds of the historical forest Bosque de Chapultepec (2 times larger than Central Park) in which you can find national landmarks like the beautiful Chapultepec Castle located on Chapultepec Hill, home to the Mexican Emperor Maximiian I and his consort Carlot

Nice and safe residential area built over a 19th century hacienda and hippodrome that were divided into what nowadays are Colonia Roma, Colonia Condesa and Colonia HipÃ³dromo.

Since its early beginnings La Condesa has accommodated Argentinean, Jewish, Spanish and German communities; this mixture of cultures has left a mark in the neighborhood.

Parque MÃ©xico and Parque EspaÃ±a were built in 1921 and since then they have been essential components for the cityscape of the zone. Stories of today and anecdots from the past coexist both in these landmarks, heritage of the entire city.

La Condesa has evolved to become one of the most cosmopolitan and safe neighborhoods in the city; several languages intermingle at its restaurants and coffee shops. It is common to run into intellectual or famous personalities.

Colonia RomaÂ is one of the coolest neighborhoods in Mexico City.Â Â 

Best transportation options inÂ Colonia Roma?Â 
While public Metrobuses run down the main roads that border Roma, your best bet for within the neighborhood is walking or biking. Walking down the wide, colorful avenues gives you the time and space to enjoy the architecture, discover hidden boutiques, and take in the energy from this incredible neighborhood.Â 
For more efficient transportation, utilize the bike lanes along Avenida de los Insurgentes. For bicycle rental options, there are numerous EcoBici stations scattered throughout Roma. In order to use EcoBici, you must have a card, so they arenât ideal for tourists with a limited travel window. Weekend or week-long travelers would have better luck with private bike rentals likeÂ Casai Bikes, available to rent in select Roma Norte units.

Markets are a dependable feature of all neighborhoods in Mexico City. Roma is home to some of the best!Â Â

neighborhood_overview: Just like in 18th Century, you can walk through the traditional cobbled streets towards Santo Domingo Square which is a few steps away; our building is surrounded by tons of history and folklore that make this, the perfect scenario to discover MexicoÂ´s soul from the inside.  The history of this area bring us to the Pre Colonial Era, since this site was in ancient times the CuauhtÃ©moc Palace, around few blocks you will find 500 years of history, from archeological sites such as Templo Mayor, to Architectural Treasures such as the Metropolitan Cathedral, The Palace of  Fine Arts or Santa Catarina Square. The Coliseo Arena is right next to us, so this is the perfect chance to let yourself embrace by the mystique of Lucha Libre Mexicana.
host_about:
MyPlace Leisure Homes

Â¡MI CASA ES TU CASA!

When you stay in one of our properties, youÂ´ll get to experience our history, culture and people with an immersive feel of our traditions all with a touch of design to immerse yourself in our culture. Whether a âlucha libreâ decored flat in Centro HistÃ³rico, an ultra luxury condo in Acapulco, or a restored colonial house, we handpick every one of our homes to give them a unique charm and character and all of them with modern, first-rate amenities and handcrafted local comforts so you can truly relax when visiting Mexico.

name: Spacious, 3bed, quiet apartment, recent remodel
description:
A brilliantly located, spacious flat in between two lovely parks in La Condesa.
Easy walking distance to all the best bars & restaurants, kids play parks, free public gyms, boutique shops, galleries, malls, cinemas, museums and supermarkets but far enough to get a good nights sleep. Close to Metro Sevilla & Sonora Metrobus stop. Ideal for couples, families, groups of friends and professionals. Three bedrooms with queen-size beds in each, lockable doors and a generous, bright communal area.

The space
The apartment is on the 3rd floor and has three good-sized bedrooms with a large closet in each one. Please note that there is no elevator so is not ideally suited to anyone with mobility issues. Each bedroom has its own lock for privacy. The communal areas include the kitchen, dining area and living-room as well as the two bathrooms.

The kitchen is fully equipped with a cooker, microwave, blender, toaster, coffee maker, kettle, and all the nece
neighborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the 'trendiest' areas in Mexico City and also one of the safest. It's full of great wee places to explore on foot including a wealth of bars, restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops.
Parque MÃ©xico and EspaÃ±a are great for wandering around or exercising - both have free open air gym facilities and jogging tracks - and are the perfect option if you have kids as they both have excellent play parks and are just 100 meters from the apartment.
If you fancy a bit more of an adventure the massive Chapultepec park is just 1km away, it's brilliant for running, walking, cycling or visiting the museums and huge free zoo inside it.
Roma neighbourhood is also just a stone's throw away which is another great neighbourhood, that's where you'll find Mercado Medellin, our favourite market for all things food related.

name: ECLECTIC DESIGN SUITE-C
description:
My accommodation is good for couples, adventurers and business travelers.

The space
Welcome to Casa Corp!
* FREE INTERNET ACCESS + CABLE TV
* FREE CLEANING SERVICE + FREE LAUNDRY
* FREE USE OF IN-ROOM SAFE
* LOCATION:
The apartment is located in Condesa, which is the vibrant and modern part of the city. Just a foot step away, there are many trendy restaurants. You will find everything from a traditional taqueria (typical Mexican tacos) to a high end modern fusion cuisne.
If you enjoy parks to walk or for the morning jog, "Parque Mexico" and "Parque EspaÃ±a" are in less than 5 minutes walking distance.
One great thing about Condesa is also that at night you can find everything from a hip alternative bar, or a fancy place to take out a date.
Taxis are relatively cheap in Mexico and available 24hours. If you prefer to use local transportation (Metro + Bus), big stations are also less than 5 minutes walking distance away.

Si usted disfruta de los parques para caminar o para la sacudida de la maÃ±ana, "Parque MÃ©xico" y "Parque EspaÃ±a" son en menos de 5 minutos a pie. Una gran cosa sobre Condesa es tambiÃ©n que por la noche se puede encontrar de todo, desde una barra de la cadera alternativa, "estilo pub irlandÃ©s" o un lugar de lujo para llevar a cabo una fecha. Los taxis son relativamente baratos en MÃ©xico y 24 horas disponible. Si prefiere utilizar el transporte local (Metro + Bus), grandes estaciones estÃ¡n a menos de 5 minutos a pie.

Great location, enjoyable neighborhood.
This apartment is located in the central Colonia NÃ¡poles (colonias are neighborhoods in Mexican cities). This upper middle class neighborhood is in DelegaciÃ³n Benito JuÃ¡rez, the borough with the highest socioeconomic index in Mexico.
Colonia NÃ¡poles is one of the safest neighborhoods in the city and home to a number of landmarks such as the Mexico World Trade Center (a complex with offices, restaurants, cinemas and shopping), and the Polyforum Cultural (performing arts center decorated with distinctive murals). The original beautiful colonial-style houses have been turned into offices and restaurants, bringing life and joy to the neighborhood.
Within a five-minute walk, you will find grocery stores, a supermarket, cafÃ©s, restaurants, cinemas, gymnasiums, and the Patriotismo Shopping Center.

name: "The blue" room, next to Frida Kahlo's house.
description:
Coyoacan Center is a cultural space full of history and art located in the heart of Mexico City; It is a place filled of mystical area formed by theaters, museums, parks, cafes, restaurants, bookstores and bars which attract people from around the world.
The House of HernÃ¡n CortÃ©s and Frida Kahlo, among other things, are only a few steps from this property, which is designed for couples, families, businesses and travelers with or without pets.
We are waiting for you!

The space
The place is in one of the most beautiful and exclusive areas of the CDMX. Right at the heart of Coyoacan, full of magic and cultural activities.

We want you to feel at home. We do not discriminate on grounds of race, disability, religion, gender, health, sexual orientation, ethnicity, age or national origin. You're always be welcome...

Guest access
Hi. You'll have access to the kitchen, laundry center and we have 2 bikes, Â you can use to explore
neighborhood_overview:
The center of Coyoacan is a place of magic and mystic place that allows you to get an idea about the cultural diversity of MÃ©xico. We are located in the Old Town "la Conchita", where Hernan Cortes built a farm and a Church that was his home during the early colonial times. Today is a beautiful museum and restaurant. We are also very close to "Casa Frida Kahlo", artistic icon in the history of Mexican art.

Today Coyoacan is one of the most important cultural centers of the country, is an area filled with museums, cafes, bookstores, theaters, bars and restaurants where young people, families and intellectuals throughout the city come to enjoy and share with all visitors from other countries.
The cobbled streets and old buildings downtown Coyoacan, with its beautiful Kiosco generate an unforgettable stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Santa Fe es un tesoro urbano, rodeado de impresionantes rascacielos y edificios que hacen gala del talento arquitectÃ³nico nacional. Resaltan a la vista la "Torre Arcos Bosques", conocida por los capitalinos como "El PantalÃ³n", y tambien el "Conjunto Calakmul", que hace alusiÃ³n a la antigua y majestuosa ciudad Maya; obra del arquitecto mexicano AgustÃ­n HernÃ¡ndez, y considerada como una de las mÃ¡s extraÃ±as y vanguardistas del paÃ­s.

Para ir de compras, el Centro Comercial Santa Fe es una excelente opciÃ³n, tiene una pista de hielo, cine, diversos restaurantes, y es casa de reconocidas marcas internacionales como Saks Fifth Avenue, Zara, Forever 21, y H&M.
La cartelera del Teatro Zentrika es muy variada, y Expo Bancomer Santa Fe siempre cuenta con interesantes exposiciones comerciales, ferias, congresos y convenciones.
Si viajas con niÃ±os de 3 a 14 aÃ±os, amarÃ¡n ir a Kidzania Santa Fe, una ciudad interactiva llena de diversiÃ³n, con una superficie de mÃ¡s de 7000 metros

name: Mayan Sparrow, Stylish Apartment in Casa Quetzal
description:
Fall in love with one of the most iconic neighborhoods of Mexico City from this beautiful apartment, meticulously curated and designed, thinking of everything you need to make your stay an unforgettable experience, a place to live the city and feel at home. Explore "La Roma" from this unbeatable and central location of Casa Quetzal and discover the restaurants, cafes, bookstores and art galleries that this neighborhood and its surroundings house. A perfect neighborhood to explore on foot.

The space
Each of our apartments in Casa Quetzal has a room, a private bathroom and a main area with beautiful views and natural light where you will find the living room, dining room and a comfortable place to work from home. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to prepare coffee in the morning or cook the purchase of fresh and local products that you can find in the markets and tianguis of the city.

Guest access
All the apartments in Ca
neighborhood_overview: The Roma neighborhood began its development in 1906 by the wealthiest families of the time who were looking for a quiet and secluded refuge, but well connected to the city center. It was designed with wide boulevards, squares, tree-lined ridges, typical Parisian public sculptures and an eclectic architecture that combines styles from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. A perfect neighborhood to explore on foot and discover the spaces that emerge daily with innovative and creative proposals, to visit the restaurants and canteens that offer the most recognized cuisine of our country or to enjoy the afternoon with a glass of wine from a terrace in front of the park . Currently "La Roma" is at the center of everything that is happening in the city and Casa Quetzal is the perfect place to start your experience.
host_about:

Welcome home!

The Coliseo Arena is right next to us, so this is the perfect chance to let yourself embrace by the mystique of Lucha Libre Mexicana.

There's a laundry one block away.

xolo is the Aztec dog, in the Aztec cosmovision xolos were viewed as guardians - warding off both intruders and evil spirits, also they were considered your spiritual guides to the other world. Our xolo will be your host and guide. 

Francisco Pardo is the architect of the apartments. 

Welcome

host_about:
Im a Mexican who loves to travel so decided to rent out my home while im not around. I love Airbnb since its the perfect way to travel and to receive like minded guests. I have prepared a full on home & City Guide with my personal recommendations for food, art galleries, sites, museums & parks this way you will be able to experience Mexico city as a local and not fall into the tourist traps. 
Feel free to let me know what the purpose of your visit is and if you need some extra tips :) 

Please treat my home like you would your own :)

*If you want to know more about the house I was interviewed for a interior design magazine to talk about my home  the title of the publication is "Blending Modern with Vintage in This Stunning Mexico City  Home" you can find it on the internet. Below the full article:

BLENDING MODERN WITH VINTAGE IN THIS STUNNING MEXICO CITY HOME

Located in Mexico cityâs stylish San Miguel Chapultepec neighborhood, Santiago Vertiz first moved into his 2006-built home ten years ago.

At the time, Santiago didnât own furniture and slept on a mattress in the empty space â an image in stark contrast to the harmonious blend of modern vs vintage we now see. Vertiz spent years searching for pieces that inspire him, whilst highlighting his Mexican culture.
Fascinated by pre-Columbian cultures and inspired by childhood memories of his grandparentsâ houses, many antique pieces fill the house, as well as colourful original modern art, handicrafts and textiles from Mexico and Guatemala.

Nature plays an important role throughout the home, and an entire wall of glass doors opens to the patio, seamlessly blending the indoors with the outdoors. Says Vertiz, âPlants play a very important role in life and in my home. They are the protagonists that bring life, change, and color.â
Santiagoâs mission has been to recover, collect, restore, and redesign furniture and other pieces that inspire him, while working with the houseâs unique architectural features to amplify its height and to bring life to the space.

What attracted you to your home?
Mexico City can be very hectic, you can easily spend half of your life in traffic. I felt it was a luxury to be able to walk to places without using a car.
I knew I wanted to live in a central location, close to the classic neighborhoods â Condesa, Roma and Polanco are some of the most well-known, but also in high demand. A friend introduced me to San Miguel Chapultepec, which is a residential neighborhood making it quiet, safe and strategically located. Itâs across the street from Bosque de Chapultepec and home to many artists and galleries.
Secondly, I was excited by the architectural project. The architectâs goal was to make a town house project resembling a loft, instead of a classical building. There are actually ten identical houses with spacious, double-height ceilings overlooking a private terrace.
When I discovered the space, it had already been built, but I was able to modify the size of the terrace space, and since the view is very important to me, we made a front wall to allow plants to grow in.

Did you have a vision for your home?
I wanted my house to be a place I felt comfortable in, that I could enjoy and feel relaxed. I didnât want to have a party house â as I said to an old roommate, âMy house is my templeâ.
I had to improvise and play around a lot with the location of certain pieces, so there was trial and error involved. I would stay up at night thinking of new things I could do to the house â it was a lot of fun!

How did your fascination with pre-Columbian cultures influence the design of your home?
My maternal grandparents came from Merida, Yucatan and had deep knowledge of Mayan cultures. My grandfather would tell us tales of his many visits into the jungle and his friendship with archeologist Alberto Ruz Lhuillier. Not only was he present in the discovery of the Pakal tomb, but he actually helped by providing some of the machinery needed to uncover the tomb. My oldest uncle, a boy at the time, took the first pictures ever of the tomb. Iâve inherited a deep admiration and respect for the Mayas and their communities.
One spring break my parents took us on a road trip, passing through Veracruz into Chiapas, and visiting different ruins along the way. We camped out in the middle of the jungle, next to the Usumacinta river on the border of Mexico and Guatemala. We walked some distance to the ruins of Yaxichilan, and in another location camped with a Lacandon Community, reliving the experience that my grandfather once had.
When I visit a region, anywhere in the world, I value the nativesâ culture and appreciate the hard work and beauty that goes into their handcrafts.

It is surrounded by local life, parks, markets, all sorts of local shops, restaurants, street food, night spots, particularly accessible distance to other tourist points (museums, landmarks, etc), bordering to other trendy districts like Condesa, JuÃ¡rez, Polanco plus close/away enough yet not too far from old downtown (city square).
host_about:
Eager to host  and meet new people like you everyday and give my best advice about your adventure in Mexico City.
I lived working in the service/tourism business for 5 years in Playa del Carmen Mexico, a tourism industry focused city in the Mexican Caribbean, where I learnt the tourism business and met many travelers like myself and you.
From my experience working in the tourism industry and as a traveler as well I know first hand how helpful a good tip can be in regards to where to go, places of interest, where to eat, how to get around and the importance of knowing where to go in case of a health emergency and how to stay safe. 

I currently live in Mexico City, work has brought me back to the city where I am from.
As a local and having been around for nearly 40 years I know the city extremely well. If you need any tips on where to eat, where to go, how to get around, and maybe more important WHERE NOT TO, WHEN NOT TO, and HOW NOT TO make sure to ask. I want my guests to have a great time in my place, my city and my country.

Traveling and meeting new people is my passion. I have been to many places (not enough yet) and met loads of amazing people along the way. Been in the tourism/service business for nearly 15 years, in direct contact with foreigners and expats for nearly 25, so I can communicate and advise about pretty much anything with particular great expertise. I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.
Unless Iâm out of town or in exceptional circumstances, very few times I donât meet my guests. I've hosted around a thousand guests from all over Mexico and the world, with a thousand different stories. I will always be interested to hear yours, happy and eager to meet travelers like you and will try to make your stay at my place as pleasant as possible.

name: Zen apartment near UNAM
description:
This beautiful apartment is located in the south core of Mexico city, steps away from the National Autonomous University of Mexico (UNAM) and the National Institute of Pediatrics (INP). Three shopping malls are at near distance and local shops are to be found at the throw of a stone. The neighborhood is safe, family oriented and surrounded by green areas. The place is totally furnished and equipped with amenities.

The space

I furnished this apartment just after coming back from a trip to Japan, where I was impressed by the simplicity and the beauty they put into their houses. For that reason it features a clean and minimalistic style and you can trust it to be a perfect place for work or relaxation.

name: Lovely spacious apartment Roma Sur.
description:
Spacious one-bedroom apartment in Roma Sur.
The apartment is clean and comfortable and would hopefully provide for most of your needs. It is located in Roma Sur, a quiet traditional neighborhood which is also popular among young people and is full of little cafes, bars and restaurants. It is also a few blocks away from Roma Norte and Condesa which are the trendiest neighborhoods with rich cultural and night life.

The space
You can go up to the roof to enjoy the urban view and beautiful city sunsets.

Guest access

neighborhood_overview:
The building is situated on a nice little quiet street round the corner from Cine Tonala, a cultural center, independent cinema and restaurant. 5 min away you would find Huerto Roma Verde which is another interesting spot. Lots of other cafes, restaurants and bars around and a big park in a walking distance.
Just a block away from the Mercado Medellin, a colorful traditional market where you can find anything starting from fruits, good coffee, spices, ending up with pottery and household items.
You can also enjoy a fresh juice, an economic and delicious traditional breakfast and lunch or have a great seafood meal inside the market.
There is a also a big supermarket a few blocks away from the apartment.

description:
Make Mexico City your new home, while doing your best work. This beautifully decorated apartment, featuring a comfortable working space, has everything you need to be inspired and productive while exploring one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in the city.

Take a break and walk to Amsterdam Avenue or grab coffee at Parque Mexico, both just around the corner.

The building has 24/7 security, an impressive roof with a fully-equipped gym and a 360 view of the beautiful Mexico City.

The space
Apartment's layout and decor gives it a homey atmosphere perfect for working during the day, and enjoying it in the afternoons. Spacious, fully-equipped kitchen with all essentials, dishwasher and more. Separate room for laundry with washer/dryer. The TV room is a great nook for relaxing and whining down. Dining table with 8 seatings, perfect for stay-at-home dinners. And the living room next to the balcony overlooking the street is another great area f
neighborhood_overview:
La Condesa is an area of Mexico City that, together with Colonia Roma, it is designated as a "Barrio MÃ¡gico TurÃ­stico" ("Magic Neighborhood for Tourists"). Together they are often referred to as CondesaâRoma, one of the most architecturally significant and bastion of the creative communities of the city.

The area is considered to be fashionable and popular with younger businesspeople, students and pet lovers. It features a large number of international restaurants, bars and nightclubs.

"Condesa" means "countess" and it is named after MarÃ­a Magdalena DÃ¡valos de Bracamontes y Orozco, the Countess of Miravalle, whose lands stretched from what is now Colonia Roma to Tacubaya.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very well located, right in the middle of the city. It is connected with many avenues and public transport means, which makes it very easy to get from here to almost any other area in the city. Minutes away, even by foot, are the WTC, the Condesa and Roma touristic neighborhoods. We also are part of the Ecobici program, so there are several bycicle stations around the house where you can rent a bike for short rides. The area is lively, full of interesting little restaurants and places, young people, but is still more quiet and less gentrified than the more expensive areas, like the famous Condesa.

name: Beautiful apartment in the best Polanco location!
description:
Stylish and bright Polanco apartment in the middle of "Polanquito", half a block away from Lincoln park!
This apartment has it all: Location, comfort and style. Also, it's huge! And Polanco's vibrant life starts right at your door steps: restaurants, bars, supermarket and great shopping. And at the same time you enjoy a nice view on lovely trees and the local scene.

The apartment is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids) and groups.

The space
This apartment is a modern, large space (220 m2!) with lots of sunlight with 3 spacious bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a large kitchen and a huge dining and living area. The apartment is located in a 5 story building (2nd floor) in the middle of Polanco, right next to Lincoln park for minimum 2-night stays.

All bedrooms have very comfortable beds (king and queen) and blackout shades or curtains. The walls of the three bedrooms have been freshly painted.
neighborhood_overview:
Polanco (and specifically "Polanquito") is one of the best and safest neighborhoods in Mexico-City with lots of foreigners living in the area. Around the corner is the nice Lincoln park, which is great for morning runs, afternoon strolls and people-watching. Ideal for business visitors and tourists!

Right outside the door you have access to plenty of international and local restaurants, coffee shops, great fresh juice spots, a supermarket, shops, pharmacy, dry cleaning etc. Presidente Mazaryk Av (the glamorous shopping street) is just a block away from the apartment.
host_about:
I am from Germany and divide my time between San Francisco and Mexico City. 

I am a cofounder of a technology startup. I have been offering my Mexico apartment now for a few years and I am excited that I just recently added a new Airbnb exclusive apartment in the same building, I hope you love it as much as I do! 

As a host, I love to meet new people from all over the world and make them feel comfortable during their stay. I am a big fan of Mexico and love traveling, good food, yoga and everything that is good for the soul :)

name: Centric studio with shared terrace in la NÃ¡poles
description:
Comfy little studio near the WTC and Condesa at the rooftop of the building. Ideal for one person, a couple or two friends who wish to take the best out of Mexico City.

The space
The studio is located at the rooftop of the building and has a nice terrace to hang out and relax. The ambiance and the view are swell.

The studio has a full-sized bed, a kitchen, a personal bathroom, a breakfast bar furniture, a TV and multiple services included.

The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs. The stairs are pretty light (in my opinion), as the apartment is located in the 5th floor.

The location is great! Really centric and close to public transportation. It is two blocks away from the World Trade Center and the Condesa neighborhood is just 3km away.

The neighborhood is well known and contemporar
neighborhood_overview: As I stated before, the neighborhood is well known and contemporary, it shares multiple similarities with the Condesa neighborhood in terms of cultural history.
host_about:
Hi! I am an internationalist and I work in an NGO in Mexico City. 

I love food, culture, arts, coffee, books, traveling, learning new languages and meeting people from other cultures and countries. 

Because of my studies, I have lived in Germany, France and Switzerland. I worked for the UN in Geneva for three months. Since then Iâve been traveling around the world, from Argentina to Nairobi. 

Right now I work with indigenous peoples in Mexico. Nice to meet you!

name: Best location with heated pool, gym, bar
description:
Right in the heart of trendy Condesa neighborhood with a wide variety of dining, shopping and cultural options, all within walking distance. Youâll love my place because of the ambiance, the location, and the amenities. The building has a swimming pool, bar, valet parking, and laundry service. There is a queen-size bed in the main bedroom and two individual beds in the guest bedroom.

The space
The location and roof are spectacular and a definite highlight of your stay. Spend your free time in a hotel-like amenities overlooking the Mexico City skyline from the heated pool or working out in the gym. There is also a snack bar where you can order food and drinks :)

Guest access
You have full access to the apartment and the building's amenities including, heated pool, snack bar, and gym.

I do need to receive a copy of your ID at least two days before your arrival, otherwise you may not have access to the building.

Also, n
neighborhood_overview:
La Condesa is cool and trendy with abundant street life, plenty of restaurants, bars, parks, art, shops and so much more. If you like running outdoors, you are right next to Parque Espana or Parque Mexico where you will find many (and probably me) that are out for a run in the park. My place is also close to La Roma, the bohemian neighborhood next door, worth visiting as well and you are 10 minutes (car) away from Polanco and about 20 minutes away from Zocalo (approx. depending on traffic). On Sundays, the area (mainly Reforma) closes for car traffic and everyone goes out running and biking or rollerblading on the main streets that connect these neighborhoods. It's a great way to visit the city.

I feel it's safe to walk around day and night. There are always people around. As anywhere in the World, being careful and aware is always helpful.

neighborhood_overview:
Eastbound is Mexico Cityâs âHistoric Districâ dates back to the 13th century Aztec Empire and thru the Spanish 16th century colonial age. At the Zocalo plaza, just a few streets east of the apartment, you will find the remains of the Aztec emperor Moctezumaâs temple next to the National Palace, the official government residence, that thrives with artist Diego Riveraâs murals and the monumental Cathedral built on top of the pagan temple, symbol of Mexican religious devotion and Spanish conquest. As you walk thru the streets of the district you will experience centuries of history along with live shows, people dressed in traditional outfits, original architecture and amazing cuisine.

Westbound is modern Mexico City. Along Reforma avenue is the financial district with modern architecture and malls. Further west is Chapultepec Forest that houses the colonial age viceroy residence. Going south there are colonia Roma and Condesa, which are considered the modern art districts

description:

This apt has 2 rooms, the first one is big and the second is small, does not have windows and works more like a complementary service with a little full bathroom on it.

The apt is 100% private, the garden is not shared.
Our stove is electric, and we have carbon monoxide detectors.

A perfect place to rest and recharge your batteries after work or sightseeing.
The apartment is brand new and completely independent. It's equipped to enjoy breakfast or other meals. The apt also has open spaces to enjoy Mexico's mild climate. You'll find a full sized bed as well as a sofa bed. A fully equipped granite kitchen with stove, coffee maker machine, small fridge and necessary plates and utencels.

A private garden
neighborhood_overview:

It is not allowed to have events and parties, if you persist we will finish your reservation and you will get a fine, please behave. Check out our surveillance cameras policy.

neighborhood_overview:
Colonia TrÃ¡nsito is located in the south of the historic center of the city. The apartment is near to the most tourist areas in the city downtown, such as, Zocalo, Palace of Bellas Artes, Reforma, Colonia Roma, and the Monument to the Revolution, which are some of the most famous places in Mexico City.

There is a metro station just 5 minutes away by foot, which will take you to the most famous area. You can even get to places without taking public transport.

In the neighborhood, there are many small and cheap restaurants with the most typical food in the city or you have plenty of options using Uber Eats or Rappi.

It is a 10-minute walk to a newly opened shopping center that has a Wal-Mart and a Sams. There is also a food court area, several outlet stores, and even a cinema.

It is a great area to stay at if you are visiting this big city and if you want to visit different places and take advantage of the time.

- Malls: Plaza Carso (2 min), Antara Fashion Hall (5 min), Miyana (10 min), Palacio de Hierro (15 min), PabellÃ³n Polanco (15 min).
- Museums and theatres: Museo Soumaya (2 min), Telcel Theatre - usually playing Broadway shows (2 min), Anthropology Museum (15 min car drive), Independence Angel (15 min car drive).
Nightlife: Joy Room Nightclub (5 min), Condesa and Roma (area full of restaurants and bars, 15 minute car drive).

Please consider that this is a noisy city, at least until 11pmâ¦ In the morning you may listen to voices and the guy who sell gas, yelling âel gaaaaaaasâ, also the bells of the garbage truck.
The parties get used to be in the middle of fireworks. Do not get scare, this is part of the folklore.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of Mexico City, this neighborhood is a hidden gem that offers a truly authentic Mexican experience. With its charming cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and vibrant energy, you'll feel transported to another world.

But what really sets this neighborhood apart is its friendly and welcoming community. Whether you're strolling down the street, enjoying a local meal at a nearby restaurant, or simply relaxing in a park, you'll find that the locals here are always eager to strike up a conversation and share their stories.

But don't let the neighborhood's classic charm fool you â there are plenty of modern amenities to enjoy as well. From trendy cafes and boutique shops to exciting nightlife options, this neighborhood has something for everyone.

Overall, if you're looking for an unforgettable and truly authentic Mexican experience, look no further than this hidden gem of a neighborhood.

description:
Comfy little studio near the WTC and Condesa at the rooftop of the building. Ideal for one person, a couple or two friends who wish to take the best out of Mexico City.

The space
The studio is located at the rooftop of the building and has a nice terrace to hang out and relax. The ambiance and the view are swell.

The studio has a full-sized bed, a kitchen, a personal bathroom, a breakfast bar furniture, a TV and multiple services included.

The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs.

The location is great! Really centric and close to public transportation. It is two blocks away from the World Trade Center and the Condesa neighborhood is just 3km away.

The apartment has a large bedroom with a terrace that fills with sunshine in the afternoon. The large living room has a couch and a smart TV. A perfect space to relax and hang out. The kitchenette is equipped with a refrigerator, a stove and a large dining table. The bathroom has a shower and a dressing room.

host_about:
I am a contented 70's year old physician who worked at UNAM - the main University in Mexico - for many years.

I am now retired, my children are grown-ups and I own a lovely house in Colonia Condesa.

I have multiple interests and activities that fill my schedule since my retirement. I work as a therapist, I study Eastern philosophies, I love to go to the movies and to concerts, to travel and to spoil my grandson.

I am looking forward to meet all interesting people who want to enjoy the peace of this quiet place in the heart of Condesa.

Santa MarÃ­a la Ribera is a fusion of history and the modern world, combining great architectural and historical value with a shopping mall, restaurants, and much more. It is considered the first modern subdivision of Mexico City. First emerging in 1861, Santa MarÃ­a is filled with houses embedded with a long history, many preserved to this day: a glimpse into the world of the late nineteenth century. Some key examples are:
â¢Casa de los Mascarones (âHouse of the Masksâ)
â¢Museo Universitario del Chopo (âChopo University Museumâ)
â¢Alameda de Santa MarÃ­a, with its Moorish and Chinese inspirations, built for the Universal Exhibition of New Orleans of 1884
â¢Museo de GeologÃ­a de la UNAM (âMuseum of Geology of UNAMâ)
â¢Parroquia del EspÃ­ritu Santo (âChurch of the Holy Spiritâ)
â¢Parroquia de La Sagrada Familia (âTemple of the Sacred Familyâ)
Also being in an exciting time of emerging modern development, Santa MarÃ­a la Ribera also contains many restaurants and c

host_about:
Soy Carlos, relajado y divertido, me gusta platicar, me gusta viajar, y trato de hacer ejercicio a diario... me gustan los animales y en la medida de lo que puedo trato de cuidar el medio ambiente.

Soy director de TV asi que viajo mucho y mis horarios cuando tengo proyecto son muy largos seguidos de periodos sin hacer nada... mi casa es su casa y siempre he sido asi, me gusta recibir gente, me gusta hacer amigos.

Soy divorciado y tengo dos hijos que no viven conmigo, la que si vive conmigo es mi perrita BullDog Mikaela, pero ahora esta fuera de Mexico de visita con los abuelos en Tijuana, yo vivo entre CDMX, Los Angeles y Tijuana, normalmente ella viaja conmigo a todos lados.

Amo la fotografia, la pintura, y el arte en general, creo por eso siempre me he dedicado a actuar o dirirgir.

espero su estadia en casa sea placentera y disfruten esta ciudad que me acogio con brazos abiertos hace 30 aÃ±os y la amen como yo lo hago a pesar de todos sus problemas.

saludos


I'm Carlos, relaxed and fun, I like to talk, I like to travel, and I try to exercise daily ... I like animals and as far as I can, I try to take care of the environment.

I am a TV director so I travel a lot and my schedules when I have a project are very long followed by periods without doing anything ... "my house is your house" and I have always been like this, I like to receive people, I like to make friends.

I am divorced and I have two children who do not live with me, the one that lives with me is my dog BullDog Mikaela, but now she is out of MÃ©xico visiting with the grandparents in Tijuana, I live between CDMX, Los Angeles, and Tijuana, normally she travels with me to everywhere.

I love photography, painting, and art in general, I think that's why I've always been dedicated to acting and directing.

I hope your stay at home is pleasant and enjoy this city that welcomed me with open arms 30 years ago and love it as I do in spite of all its problems.

regards

name: Fabulous, Sunny, Studio in Condesa
description:
My studio is located in the heart of la CONDESA, one of the best and most walkable neighbourhoods in Mexico City.
You'll enjoy taking a stroll through Parque MÃ©xico and Avenida Amsterdam, taking a coffee break at one of many fabulous cafÃ©s, shopping at some of the trendiest shops and boutiques and having dinner at some of Mexico City's most delicious restaurants.

The space
Located on the 8th floor of a 16 floor apartment building, this studio is the perfect base for anyone who wants to discover what Mexico City has to offer.
There is one bedroom with a double bed, a living room with a sofa that converts into a double bed, one and a half bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen, a laundry room with a washer/dryer and a terrace with a great sunset view.
The bedroom has no door so it's important you are familiar with whomever you're sharing the flat with.
The building has 24 hour security and an elevator.

Other thin

CoyoacÃ¡n se mantuvo completamente independiente de la Ciudad de MÃ©xico durante el periodo colonial, en el siglo XIX. En 1857, el Ã¡rea fue incorporada en el Distrito Federal. Muchos de sus espacios han conservado sus diseÃ±os, plazas y calles estrechas. De su oferta cultural destacan los museos Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera-Anahuacalli, Leon Trotsky, Nacional de las Culturas Populares y el Nacional de las Intervenciones. El centro de CoyoacÃ¡n, con su jardÃ­n Centenario y su Plaza Hidalgo es un paseo casi obligado. Para irse de fiesta por la noche La B o Centenario 107 son muy buenas opciones, aunque El Hijo del Cuervo ha logrado convertirse en un clÃ¡sico de la zona. En 2011 fue designado Barrio MÃ¡gico del DF.

name: 2C - Suite Calandria in San Angel - 1BR/1BA Double
description:
Welcome to San Angel: Mexico City's most stylish and charming neighbourhood. With a tradition that goes back to our grandparents Juan and Cristina Solorzano, we look forward to welcome you into our beautiful home. Find your own green oasis in the big city by entering to our house and its lush garden. History meets modern in this fully equipped suite ready for your arrival (fresh linen, fully equipped kitchen), cable TV, wifi. For full guest reviews see: https://www.airbnb.ca/rooms/5750208

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. Recharge your energies at the end of the day or start with a cup of coffee enjoying the sunshine in the lush grounds.

Afterwards, go for a stroll on the pebble-stoned narrow streets of San Ange
neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interestin
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

name: Lovely Room, Work Space and Roof Garden downstairs
description:
Beautifully furnished duplex located right in the heart of the hip colonia JuÃ¡rez, which is home to a variety of trendy restaurants, cafÃ©s, bars, organic markets, parks and yoga studios.
Your bedroom is downstairs and has its own private bathroom, next to the room is a room suited for working.
You have access to the whole house, including an fully equiped kitchen, indoor-garden and a sunny terrace: a green oasis right at the center of this amazing city. The house is run by solar heating.

The space
The house is fully renovated and receives an abundance of light through its glass ceiling. It is very quiet at the end of a gated walkway (privada), perfect for a relaxing stay. The decor is modern with floors of wood and concrete, while the windows are made of steel and preserve the original style of the house, which was built in the 50s.

Iâm living here on my own with my dog Nneka (Vizsla) and I always just accept one guest/ couple.
neighborhood_overview: The Colonia JuÃ¡rez has been an up-and-coming neighborhood for the last 5 years and as more and more restaurants, cafÃ©s and other businesses open it is a safe place. There is a small "plaza" with a playground just 1 block away and you have several places to eat, both taco stands and highly-rated restaurants. During the day itÂ´s quite busy as the Avenida Reforma with itÂ´s skyscrapers and offices is just 3 blocks away, while at night it has a calmer atmosphere. ItÂ´s a really safe place (otherwise there would not be as many foreigners living here). The house is located perfectly as Colonia Roma with its trendy bars is just a few blocks away, the Centro and most of the museums is 5 minutes by bike and in 10 minutes you are in the popular Condesa.

name: 1B - Suite Rio San Angel (1BR/1BA Double)
description:
Welcome to San Angel: Mexico City's most stylish and charming neighbourhood. With a tradition that goes back to our grandparents Juan and Cristina Solorzano, we look forward to welcome you into our beautiful home. Find your own green oasis in the big city by entering to our house and its lush garden. History meets modern in this fully equipped suite ready for your arrival (fresh linen, fully equipped kitchen), cable TV, wifi. For full guest reviews see: https://www.airbnb.ca/rooms/5750208

The space
San Angel is one of Mexico Cityâs quietest, stylish, and charming neighbourhoods. Our fully furnished suite offers an oasis from the cityâs busy environment. The property is built around a beautiful landscaped large garden that offers a peaceful and calm experience. Recharge your energies at the end of the day or start with a cup of coffee enjoying the sunshine in the lush grounds.

Afterwards, go for a stroll on the pebble-stoned narrow streets of San Ange
neighborhood_overview:
San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

San Angel is a quiet and charming town inside Mexico City. Pebble-stoned narrow streets, colonial houses, parks, plazas, colonial churches, museums and many other destinations make it a must stop in your visit to Mexico City.

Mexico Cityâs Secretary of Tourism recently named the San Angel neighborhood a Barrio Magico (Magic Neighborhood). San Angel, located 12km (7.4 miles) southwest of the historic center, was once a retreat for wealthy city residents. Cobblestone streets, plazas, gardens and elegant estates are reminiscent of the neighborhoodâs rich colonial past.

San Angel is home to monuments, historic residences, a former Dominican monastery, a cultural center housed in what was once a municipal palace and several interestin
host_about: My name is Juan Gabriel Solorzano and I am a Mexican Architecht who has lived in San Angel all his life. I know this neighbourhood well, and it is with great pride that I welcome guests here. As an architect, I pay special attention to the design and functionality of space. I trust you will find in my place a combination of comfort and elegance. I particularly enjoy landscape architecture and have built lush gardens into my properties.  What I like most form Airbnb is the opportunity to show guests a little bit of the Mexico that I love.

name: New! Stunning 3 bdrm, Iconic Building, Down Town
description:
This beautiful 3 bedroom is perfect for your stay in Mexico City.

Reforma 27, designed by renknown Architect Alberto Kalach has state-of-the-art amenities that are truly a privilege to use. A pool, jacuzzi, spa (1 hour booking per day due to COVID) will let you relax like no other building in the area while overlooking Mexico City.

We've created a contemporary yet homey interior that will suit all of your needs. An unmatched location on Paseo de la Reforma, the Champs Elysee of Mexico City.

The space
As an Architect, I'm convinced our incredibly well designed building and interiors will make your stay more comfortable, memorable and unique, all for a very reasonable price!

Our fully furnished kitchen offers everything you need from napkins to basic staples so that you can hit the ground running.

We have three beautifully decorated bedrooms, the main bedroom has a king size bed with walk-in closet and private bathroo
neighborhood_overview:
Paseo de la Reforma is truly a magical boulevard. It has most of our most important landmarks (Chapultepec Castle, Chapultepec Park, Anthropology Museum, Tamayo Museum, Modern Museum of Art, our Independence Monument, and most of our relevant skyscrapers)

On Sunday's it closes its central lanes to create on average, 50 kms of public spaces which feature around 40,000 participants every week. You'll find cyclists, pedestrians, skateboarders, zumba dancers and every other type of activity to enjoy the city. It is a world-class experience.

Additionally, we're 5 blocks away from Alameda Central, the oldest Urban Park in Latin America, which features Palacio de Bellas Artes, one of the landmark buildings of our city. We're walking distance from UNESCO heritage Centro Historico, which features all the must sees on your visit. Truly an unmatched location smack in the middle of everything you'll want to visit which will make your visit much more efficient and pleasant.
host_about: IÂ´m Alejandra Rangel, Architect and Urban Planner from Mexico City. I live in this beautiful city with my husband and daughter. I LOVE to cycle, travel and explore... I'm confident you'll love our apartment and I'm here to help in any way I can!

name: Oasis a Block from MX Central Park Chapultepec
description:
Slide open windows of the corner unit makes the light and air flood in. The walls of this sleek apartment feature Mexican artwork, which is for sale alongside contemporary author photography. Perfect for working offering 150 Mbps Internet. Only a block away from Mexico City central park Chapultepec, great for jogging and sightseeing. Access to shared rooftop. One Bedroom, but a sofa bed in the living room. There is a local market two blocks away the very intimate experience with Mexican food. El chorrito will let you see the everyday Mexico. The washing machine is inside the apartment

The apartment is small but spacious, prepared with prime quality mattress and sheets, decorated with contemporary author photography, great space for a couple with the nice option for a third person in the sofa bed out in the living room. The pictures are for sale, in case you want to bring back home mexican art.

The apartment is all acces, it also has a rooftop where BBQs can be do
neighborhood_overview: Discover the best of Mexico City's art and culture in the tranquil neighborhood in Chapultepec. Only two blocks away from the iconic Chapultepec Park, Mexico City's Central Park, you'll enjoy the ultimate blend of peace and energy. Immerse yourself in the local art scene by exploring the contemporary art galleries, museums, and exhibitions in the area. The charming street art, historic architecture, and tree-lined streets will make you feel right at home. The location also offers easy access.
host_about: I was born in Mexico CIty but lived abroad for almost a decade, Im a photographer and truly lover of my neighborhood, and my city. I know the city inside out I also work as a fixer for journalist that come to Mexico CIty from all over the world, so truly I can get you anything. description:

2022 UPDATE
At the moment I'm not living in Mx City, so Erick (my best mate) will be living there and he'll be your host alongside Martina (dog), PepinÃ³t (cat) and Muish (axolotl).

The space
I love my flat. I try to keep it ravishing all the time. I love listening to music, reading and watching movies so, naturally, most of the arrangements have been made to enjoy those sorts of things. I also like to cook, so maybe I can make something special to welcome you :)

The building is very beautiful as well, it's a very unique building in the city, you'll love it!

Guest access
Feel like home. There's no restrictions really so, do as you wish.

At th
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown is the place to be. I've worked almost everywhere in this city and there's no other place I'd rather live. It has anything you'd need, from the basics till the most extravaganza. And if you plan to go around the city you'll find no trouble getting there and back, "all roads lead to downtown" ;)
I recommend anyone yo stay at least a week at downtown to feel the vibe so what are you waiting for!?

It is considered the first modern subdivision of Mexico City. First emerging in 1861, Santa MarÃ­a is filled with houses embedded with a long history, many preserved to this day: a glimpse into the world of the late nineteenth century. Some key examples are:

â¢Museo Universitario del Chopo (âChopo University Museumâ)
â¢Alameda de Santa MarÃ­a, with its Moorish and Chinese inspirations, built for the Universal Exhibition of New Orleans of 1884

â¢Parroquia del EspÃ­ritu Santo (âChurch of the Holy Spiritâ)

name: Brand new, modern studio. Historic Downtown Mexico
description:
Very silent, safe, 24 hour doorman, WiFi, yet close to the vibrant commercial, social and cultural life in Mexico's Historic Center. Close to main square and culture centers. Surrounded with historic palaces, pre-Hispanic sites, wonderful museums, picturesque restaurants and bars. Close to the subway, the modern surface bus network and public shared-bike station. Roof top terrace with great views (smoking area), a reading room with music, WiFi & running mill.

Large two-glass windows keep the room quiet and warm.
